WHITE PEAKS RECEDING INTO THE SHROUD OF MIST
PULL BACK ON THE MAP TO REVEAL
JUMPING OVER LOGS ... DODGING TREE BRANCHES.
HARSH, GUTTURAL WORDS, THE VOICE OF SAURON EMERGES.
FASTER AND FASTER ... THEIR DARK GREEN FORESTS AND JAGGED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGE: FLICKERING FIRELIGHT. The NOLDORIN FORGE in EREGIO MOLTEN GOLD POURS from the lip of an IRON LADLE.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It began with the forging of the Great Rings. IMAGE: THREE RINGS, each set with a single GEM, are recei the HIGH ELVES - GALADRIEL, GIL-GALAD and CIRDAN. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Three were given to the Elves: immortal, wisest ... fairest of all beings. IMAGE: SEVEN RINGS held aloft in triumph by the DWARF LOR GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Seven to the Dwarf Lords: great miners and craftsmen of the mountain halls. IMAGE: NINE RINGS clutched tightly by the KINGS OF MEN .. if holding-close a precious secret. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) And Nine ... nine rings were gifted to the race of Men, who above all else desire power. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) For within these rings was bound the strength and the will to govern each race.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) But they were all of them deceived. FADE UP: An ancient PARCHMENT MAP of MIDDLE EARTH ... mov slowly across the MAP as if drawn by an unseen force the CAMERA closes in on a PLACE NAME ... MORDOR. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) ...for another Ring was made. TEASING SHOTS: SAURON forging the ONE RING in the CHAMBER SAMMATH NAUR. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) In the land of Mordor, in the fires of Mount Doom, the Dark Lord Sauron forged in secret a Master Ring to control all others. IMAGE: The ONE RING reflecting the FIERY LAVA! FIRE WRITI emerges on the plain BAND OF GOLD. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) ...and into this Ring he poured his cruelty, his malice and his will to dominate all life. IMAGE: THE ONE RING falls through SPACE and into flames.. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) One Ring to rule them all... IMAGE: A GREAT SHADOW falls across the MAP ... closing in around the realm of GONDOR...

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE
dialogues.text: their homes, pursued by ARMIES OF HIDEOUS ORCS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) One by one the Free lands of Middle earth fell to the power of the Ring. FADE TO BLACK. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) But there were some ... who resisted. FADE UP: ISILDUR, son of the KING OF GONDOR, leads an ARM ACROSS the PLAINS OF DAGORLAD... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) A last alliance of Men and Elves marched against the armies of Mordor. On the slopes of Mount Doom, they fought for the freedom of Middle-Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: commands rack after rank of ELVEN ARCHERS...

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: (Elvish) Tangado haid! Leithio i philinn! (English) Hold positions! Fire the arrows! TEASING SHOTS: ARROWS FIRING ... ORCS RETREATING before t ARMY of the LAST ALLIANCE ... ELENDIL, KING OF GONDOR, ho aloft the great SWORD ... NARSIL! GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Victory was near! IMAGES: THE HUGE, DARK FIGURE OF SAURON, bearing the ONE on his finger, looms over the field of battle... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) But the power of the Ring could not be undone. IMAGE: SAURON lays waste to the armies of the LAST ALLIAN With desperate courage, ELENDIL leads a charge ... THE BL

dialogues.speaker: MACE OF SAURON LASHES OUT
dialogues.text: IMAGE: ELENDIL’S body falls like a crumpled rag doll... IMAGE: ISILDUR cradles the body of his father in his arms SHADOW OF SAURON falls over him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) It was in this moment ... when all hope had faded, that Isildur, son of the king, took up his father's sword. ISILDUR snatches up the BROKEN BLADE OF NARSIL ... The BL severs SAURON’S FINGERS ... AND THE ONE RING FLIES from h body. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Sauron, the enemy of the Free Peoples of Middle-Earth, was defeated. SAURON’S ARMOUR clatters to the ground, his body GONE ...

dialogues.speaker: VAPROIZED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: ISILDUR picks up the SEVERED FINGER and removes ONE RING ... transfixed!

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Ring passed to Isildur ... who had this one chance to destroy evil forever. IMAGE: GLADDEN FIELD ... ISILDUR leads a small column of through DARKENING WOODS ... the ONE RING glinting on a CH around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But the hearts of Men are easily corrupted. And the Ring of Power has a will of its own. SUDDENLY! ARROWS FLY! They are ambushed by ORCS ... ISIDU is THROWN from his HORSE! ISILDUR stumbles to his feet and in a PANIC, puts on the RING and DISAPPEARS! INVISIBLE ISILDUR flees from the BATTLE and jumps into the RIVER ANDUIN. ISILDUR MATERIALIZES UNDER WATER ... as the RING slips sl from his finger. He grasps for it, desperately. ORCS on the RIVERBANK spot him in the WATER. They fire a BARRAGE OF ARROWS into him. ISILDUR JERKS. Ripples of light play across ISILDUR’S PAL he is DEAD. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) It betrayed Isildur to his death. IMAGE: ISILDUR floats down the RIVER, ARROWS lodged in hi back. IMAGE: THE RING falls through the MURKY WATERS of the RIV ANDUIN ... and into OBLIVION...

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And some things that should not have been forgotten ... were lost.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Thus a Third Age of Middle-Earth began. History became legend ... legend became myth. FADE UP: The waters of the ANDUIN RIVER lie dark and undisturbed. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) And for two and a half thousand years, the Ring passed out of all knowledge. IMAGE: SILT SWIRLS ... A THIN WHITE HAND reaches down grasping the RING... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Until, when chance came, it ensnared a new bearer. IMAGE: THE THIN WHITE HAND opens to reveal the ONE RING.

dialogues.speaker: GOLLUM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My Precious... IMAGE: MIST SHROUDED MOUNTAINS... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) The Ring came to the creature Gollum, who took it deep into the tunnels of the Misty Mountains. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGE: THE GLOOM of a MOUNTAIN CAVERN ... a MURKY POOL of WATER ... in the DARKNESS the SHADOWY OUTLINE of an EMACI FIGURE. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) And there it consumed him. A RASPY VOICE mutters in the half light...

dialogues.speaker: GOLLUM
dialogues.text: It came to me. My own. My love... (ecstatic whisper) My preciousness. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) The Ring gave to Gollum unnatural long life. For five hundred years it poisoned his mind. And in the gloom of Gollum's cave...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) It waited. FADE UP: Bathed in COLD MOONLIGHT, the WORLD lies DARK an STILL ... the unsettled quiet before the storm...

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Darkness crept back into the forests of the world. Rumor grew of a Shadow in the East ... whispers of a nameless fear. And the Ring of Power perceived ... its time had now come. It abandoned Gollum. SLOW MOTION: Unseen by its KEEPER, THE RING falls to the FLOOR of a MOUNTAIN TUNNEL... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) But something happened then the Ring did not intend...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: IMAGE: FUMBLING in the dark, a SMALL HAND closes over the RING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) It was picked up by the most unlikely creature imaginable...

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (to himself) What’s this? A YOUNGISH LOOKING BILBO BAGGINS peers down at what lies his hand ... PERPLEXED by what he has found.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A Hobbit ... Bilbo Baggins of the Shire.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (surprised) A Ring. SUDDENLY! A VOICE SCREAMS ... ITS ANGUISH RINGING through COLD, DANK TUNNELS...

dialogues.speaker: GOLLUM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lost! Lost! My Precious is lost!! Frightened, BILBO quickly POCKETS the ONE RING and hurrie

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: For the time will soon come when Hobbits will shape the fortunes of all.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A MAP OF MIDDLE-EARTH. WE MOVE from the MISTY MOUNTAINS to HOBBITON.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The 22nd day of September in the year 1400 by Shire-reckoning. Bag End, Bagshot Row, Hobbiton, Westfarthing, the Shire, Middle- earth. The Third Age of this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLES ON: The MAP rests on the floor with several other BOOKS, SCROLLS, and other similar items of research. CAMERA TRACKS: Down through the hall, we find BAG END sha this DECOR throughout its modest halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BILBO sits at his DESK, PEN IN HAND.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: There and Back Again: A Hobbit’s Tale by Bilbo Baggins. CLOSE ON: the book. The lettering on the page reads exact BILBO has dictated. He turns the next page, which is blan ANGLE ON: BILBO considers his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Now, where to begin? Ah yes... CLOSE ON: BILBO dips his pen in the ink, and begins writi

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: “Concerning Hobbits.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The small VILLAGE OF HOBBITON is a quaint rustic settlement nestled amongst rolling green hills and large The HOBBITS live in HOBBIT HOLES: neat burrows dug into t grassy hillside, with round doors and cute front gardens. MONTAGE OF SHOTS UNDER BILBO: HOBBITS plowing fields ...s pipes ... serving food ... woodworking ... leading pigs milking cattle ... tidying their porches ... and of cours sleeping. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “Hobbits have been living and farming in the four Farthings of the Shire for many hundreds of years, quite content to ignore and be ignored by the world of the Big Folk. Middle-earth being, after all, full of strange creatures beyond count, Hobbits must seem of little importance being neither renowned as great warriors nor counted among the very wise.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BILBO laughs. HE TURNS TO a KNOCK at the door. WIDE ON: BILBO in his study.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (calling out) Frodo! Someone at the door. ANGLE ON: BILBO turns immediately back to his WRITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGE: A HOBBIT, when faced with a decision between a KIS from his SWEETHEART and a MUFFIN, chooses the MUFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “In fact, it has been remarked by some that Hobbits’ only real passion is for food. IMAGE: A HOBBIT carries a BARREL OF ALE on his SHOULDER, refilling his MUG as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “A rather unfair observation as we have also developed a keen interest in the brewing of ales... IMAGE: Several HOBBITS sit around SMOKING PIPES.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “,..and the smoking of pipe-weed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: IMAGE: HOBBITS carry their fresh picked crops ... HOBBITS engaged in a leisurely game ... HOBBITS GARDENING.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “But where our hearts truly lie is in peace and quiet and good, tilled earth. IMAGE: SAMWISE GAMGEE sits in front of his house, admirin his flowers.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “For all Hobbits share a love of things that grow. IMAGE: Near a large, old tree, HOBBITS raise BANNERS AND Others bring in BARRELS OF ALE.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “And, yes, no doubt to others, our ways seem quaint. But today of all days, it is brought home to me: It is no bad thing to celebrate a simple life.” IMAGE: The HOBBITS raise a large banner that reads: “Happ Birthday Bilbo Baggins.” Others applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BILBO looking up, annoyed at yet another KNOCK interrupt him.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Frodo, the door! His CALL is met with SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Sticklebacks. Where is that boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: TWO HOBBIT FEET resting on a small rock ... ris of the LONG, OVERGROWN GRASSES.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Frodo! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS TO: A figure lies beneath the dappled sunli an old tree. White flowers are scattered among the WELL s grasses. An idyllic setting at the end of a long hot summ the figure is reading a book. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: In the distance, growing louder ... ov GENTLE CLIP CLOP of an approaching cart and horse can be the HUMMING OF A DEEP VOICE to the tune of “The Road Goes On and On...” SUDDENLY! The figure in the grass sits up ... looking str at CAMERA is a handsome young HOBBIT, with dark curly hai deep blue eyes. This is FRODO BAGGINS ... his EYES alight EXCITEMENT! Tossing away the long stem of grass in his mo FRODO runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart rattles along a leafy lane, driven by a stooped in GREY.

dialogues.speaker: JUMPING OVER LOGS ... DODGING TREE BRANCHES.
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The shambling OLD PONY snorts and rears as SUDDENLY FRODO appears on the bank above the cart.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You're late. CLOSE ON: GANDALF glowers at the young HOBBIT...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: A wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to. They look at each other for a moment ... then both start laughing as FRODO’S face breaks into a smile and he leaps the front seat of the cart.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: It's wonderful to see you, Gandalf! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Next to GANDALF, we see how small HOBBITS are ... FRODO i foot 6 inches tall.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You didn't think I'd miss your Uncle Bilbo’s birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The cart rattles past a FIELD LUPIN being tended HOBBITS.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What's new in the world? Tell me everything. ANGLE ON: GANDALF looks down at FRODO, a twinkle in his e

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: What, everything? Far too eager and curious for a Hobbit. Most unnatural... Well, what can I tell you? Life in the wide world goes on much as it has this past age. Full of its own comings and goings, scarcely even aware of the existence of Hobbits... CLOSE ON: GANDALF as he surveys the peaceful scene before GANDALF (CONT’D) ...for which I am very thankful. So, how is the old rascal? I hear this is to be a party of special magnificence.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You know Bilbo. He’s got the whole place in an uproar.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Well, that should please him.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Half the Shire’s been invited. And the rest of them are turning up anyway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The cart rattles over a stone bridge towards a B HOBBIT MARKETPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so life in the Shire goes on very much as it has this past age full of its own comings and goings, with change coming slowly... ANGLE ON: HOBBITS look up in wonder and excitement as the bearing GANDALF and FRODO rolls past the GREEN DRAGON INN

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...if it comes at all. For things are made to endure in the Shire passing from one generation to the next. CRANE UP: As the cart rattles into the small village of H . a quaint rustic settlement, nestled amongst rolling gre hills and large trees. BILBO (V.0.) (CONT’D) There’s always been a Baggins living here under the Hill in Bag End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BILBO stops writing again and looks up, thought

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: And there always will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GANDALF and FRODO continuing for their destinat

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth, Bilbo’s been a bit odd lately. I mean, more than usual. He’s taken to locking himself in his study.  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: BILBO picks up a MAP of Middle Earth.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He spends hours poring over old maps when he thinks I’m not looking. ANGLE ON: BILBO folds the map and puts it down. He pats h pants pockets. Suddenly, he looks worried. He pulls his p inside.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (worried) Where’s it gone? QUICK CUTS: BILBO desperately searches for something...un cushions ... in pockets ... through coats ANGLE ON: He shoves his hands into his vest pockets, and relieved... CLOSE ON: He removes his hand from his pocket ... his mis item clenched tightly in his fist ... he holds it to his grateful to have not lost it.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: He's up to something. FRODO shoots a knowing look, as GANDALF averts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: All right, then, keep your secrets.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: But I know you have something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Good gracious, me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Before you came along, we Bagginses were very well thought of.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Indeed?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Never had any adventures or did anything unexpected.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: If you're referring to the incident with the Dragon ... I was barely involved ...all I did was give your uncle a little nudge out the door.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Whatever you did ... you’ve been officially labeled a disturber of the peace.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Oh, really? ANGLE ON: ODO PROUDFOOT looks up as the CART passes by, d suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP: EXCITED CHILDREN, chasing after the cart. CLOSE ON: GANDALF ignores the children’s cries. The child stand deflated, watching GANDALF disappear up the lane. AT THAT MOMENT: spinning balls of bright color suddenly l of the cart, fizzing over the heads of the delighted chil ANGLE ON: GANDALF smiling to himself, well pleased with h joke. ANGLE ON: ODO PROUDFOOT is unable to suppress a chuckle. FRODO stands up in the cart as GANDALF reigns in the HORS

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Gandalf ... I'm glad you're back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO leaps expertly from the cart. GANDALF smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: So am I, dear boy...so am I.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAG END
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: GANDALF’S CART pulls up outside the gate to BAG a particularly fine example of a HOBBIT HOLE, with a larg front door set into a grassy hillside. There is a sign on gate which reads: “NO ADMITTANCE EXCEPT ON PARTY BUSINESS GANDALF strides up the garden path of BAG END. He raises staff and raps on the front door ... a voice calls out:

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No thank you! We don't want any more visitors, well-wishers, or distant relations.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: And what about very old friends? Suddenly the door opens and BILBO BAGGINS stands before h is a HOBBIT OF INDETERMINATE AGE, with a mischeivous TWIN his eye. Wearing a dashing brocade waist coat, he look ev inch the eccentric gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Gandalf?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Bilbo Baggins!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: My dear Gandalf! GANDALF drops to his knee to embrace his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Good to see you. One hundred and eleven years old, who would believe it? GANDALF looks at him more keenly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF (CONT’D) You haven't aged a day. GANDALF and BILBO laugh together and enter BAG END.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Come on, come in! Welcome, welcome! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILBO leads GANDALF into BAG END ... cozy and cluttered w souvenirs of BILBO’S travels. GANDALF has to stoop low to hitting his head on the low ceiling. BILBO hangs up GANDALF’S hat on a peg and trots off down hall.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (calling) Tea? Or maybe something a little stronger ... I’ve got a few bottle of the old Wi BILBO disappears into the kitchen as GANDALF looks around enjoying the familiarity of BAG END ... he turns, knockin head on the light and then walking into the wooden beam. GROANS. BILBO (CONT’D) I was expecting you last week. Not that it matters, you come and go as you please, always have done, always will. You’ve caught me a bit unprepared, I’m afraid ... we’ve only got cold chicken, bit of pickle, some cheese here ... ooh, no, that might be a little risky... GANDALF stops in front of a framed map, charred in one co . it is Thorin’s map of the LONELY MOUNTAIN ... GANDALF s to himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BILBO (CONT’D) Er, we’ve got raspberry jam and apple tart ... got some custard somewhere. Not much for Afters, I’m afraid. Oh no we’re alright ... I’ve just found some sponge cake. Nice little snack. Hope it’s enough. (comes into view) I could make you some eggs if you’d like? BILBO jumps, a half eaten pork pie in his hand, as GANDAL mysteriously appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Just tea, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Oh ... right. You don’t mind if...?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No, not at all. Go ahead. A SUDDEN LOUD KNOCK ON THE FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: LOBELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bilbo Baggins, you open this door...

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I'm not home. BILBO tiptoes to the window and peeps out.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (whispers) It’s the Sackville-Bagginses!

dialogues.speaker: LOBELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know you’re in there!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (whispers) They’re after the house. They’ve never forgiven me for living this long! GANDALF watches, amused, as BILBO tries to hide. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I’ve got to get away from these confounded relatives, hanging on the bell all day, never giving me a moment's peace. I want to see mountains again mountains, Gandalf ... and then find somewhere quiet where I can finish my book ... oh, Tea!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: So, you mean to go through with your plan, then?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Yes, yes ... it’s all in hand. All the arrangements are made.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Frodo suspects something.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: ‘Course he does, he's a Baggins ... not some blockheaded Bracegirdle from Hardbottle!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You will tell him, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Yes, yes.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: He’s very fond of you.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I know. He’d probably come with me if I asked him. I think, in his heart, Frodo’s still in love with the Shire, the woods and the fields ... little rivers. BILBO stands gazing out of the kitchen window. BILBO (CONT’D) I am old, Gandalf... BILBO looks at GANDALF sadly... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BILBO (CONT’D) I know I don’t look it, but I’m beginning to feel it in my heart. CLOSE ON: BILBO’S fingers close around his waistcoat pock gripping a small, unseen object. BILBO (CONT’D) I feel thin ... sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread. I need a holiday ... a very long holiday and I don’t expect I shall return in fact, I mean not to.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BAG END
dialogues.text: GANDALF and BILBO are sitting on the BAG END porch. BELOW final preparations are being made on the PARTY field. BIL strikes a match and lights his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Old Toby. The finest weed in the Southfarthing! BILBO blows a perfect smoke ring and watches it rise into air. A tiny sailing ship with masts and sails glides thro CENTER of BILBO’S smoke ring. BILBO (CONT’D) Ohhhh. (smiles) Gandalf, my old friend ... this will be a night to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A FIREWORK explodes into the night sky high above H . in the shape of a great green tree with unfolding branc TILT DOWN: with glowing flowers as they rain down from th branches ... evaporating just above the upturned faces of delighted party-goers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 144 HOBBITS, feasting and drinking CARTS of beer and wine scattered about, and the tables are piled high with steam scones and savories. GANDALF hurries about, lighting fireworks with a blue spa dances magically from his staff ... BILBO is greeting vis

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Hello, hello, Fatty Bolger, lovely to see you! Welcome, welcome! FRODO and SAM sit at a table drinking ale ... FRODO notic SAM'S eyes keep flicking to another pretty HOBBIT, ROSIE sitting some distance away.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Go on, Sam, ask Rosie for a dance.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (horrified) I think I'll just have myself another ale.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Oh, no you don't. Go on. SAM goes to drain his glass ... suddenly it is snatched o his hands as FRODO thrusts him into the middle of a passi throng of dancers. ANGLE ON: SAM’S HORRIFIED FACE as he is SWEPT away. FRODO and finishes SAM’S beer. ANGLE ON: GANDALF as he sets alight a particularly specta firework that draws gasps of admiration from the party gu CLOSE ON: BILBO is relating stories of his adventure to a of YOUNG HOBBIT CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (melodramatic) So there I was ... at the mercy of three monstrous trolls ... Have you ever heard of a Troll? Do you know what a Troll is? Great big nasty twenty foot high smelly things ... and they’re arguing arguing about how they were going to cook us! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: A LITTLE HOBBIT GIRL’S upturned face ... her ey growing larger and larger. BILBO (CONT’D) Whether it be turned on a spit or minced in a pie or whether they were going to sit on us one by one and squash us into jelly! They spent so long arguing the whither-to’s and why-for’s that the sun’s first light cracked over the top of the trees ... and turned them all to stone! STUNNED GASPS from his young AUDIENCE greet his astonishi feat! CLOSE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN, two mischeivous YOUNG HOBBITS their late teens. PIPPIN scrambles onto the back of GANDA wagon, snatching up a small firework.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: No, no ... the big one ... the big one! PIPPIN grabs a huge rocket. MERRY smiles. The pair runs o it. ANGLE ON: BILBO continues to greet his guests. He shakes with a woman who is tailed by an overwhelming crowd of CH

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bracegirdle, how nice to see you! Welcome, welcome. Are all these children yours? MRS. BRACEGIRDLE laughs with tired eyes and nods.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Good gracious, you have been productive. MRS. BRACEGIRDLE laughs and nods. SUDDENLY! Bilbo’s ears are assailed by a familiar striden VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: LOBELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bilbo? BILBO quickly runs to FRODO. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (panicked) Sackville-Bagginses! Quickly! Hide! BILBO and FRODO quickly hide behind the wall of a tent. ANGLE ON: OTHO AND LOBELIA SACKVILLE-BAGGINS ... an older grumpy-looking pair with sharp eyes ... emerge and look a the party like vultures searching for prey. ANGLE ON: BILBO breathes a huge sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Thank you, my boy. ANGLE ON: FRODO chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (suddenly serious) You're a good lad, Frodo. ANGLE ON: FRODO stares at his UNCLE, perturbed by the cha tone. BILBO (CONT’D) I'm very selfish, you know. Yes, I am . very selfish. I don't know why I took you in after your mother and father died, but it wasn't out of charity. I think ... it was because, of all my numerous relations ... you were the one Baggins that showed real spirit.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Bilbo, have you been at the Gaffer's home brew?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: No. Well, yes. But that's not the point. The point is, Frodo ... you'll be all right. BILBO lifts his mug and takes a drink ... probably of the Gaffer’s home brew. CLOSE ON: FIREWORK FUSE crackles with flame! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: MERRY is holding out the big rocket ... he look at the fizzing fuse that PIPPIN has just lit. MERRY (CONT’D) (worried whisper ) You're supposed to stick it in the ground!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: It is in the ground. MERRY fearfully tosses the ROCKET to PIPPIN! the fuse siz angrily.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Outside!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: This was your idea. PIPPIN attempts to throw the fizzing rocket back to MERRY WHOOSH! The two HOBBITS are suddenly blown off their feet shower of sparks as the rocket blasts off with frightenin power. ANGLE ON: The ROCKET ZOOMS over the party ... it suddenly apart, forming the shape of a great red golden DRAGON! Fi gushes from its nostrils as it turns back and FLIES towar startled crowd. CLOSE ON: FRODO watches the FIREWORKS DRAGON with alarm . BILBO is oblivious to the PANICKING CROWD and impending d

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Bilbo! Watch out for the dragon!!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Dragon? Nonsense ... hasn't been a dragon in these parts for a thousand years! ANGLE ON: FRODO as he hurriedly pulls BILBO to the ground as the dragon roars a few feet above their heads like a f express train! HOBBITS dive to the ground, tables overturn, tents collap food flies everywhere. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The FIREWORKS DRAGON turns a somersault and explodes over hills with a deafening BANG! This gets the biggest cheer night. ANGLE ON: MERRY AND PIPPIN, clothes and hair smoking.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: That was good!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Let's get another one! LARGE HANDS suddenly clamp down on MERRY and PIPPIN’S ear LOW ANGLE: GANDALF looking DOWN STERNLY!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Meriadoc Brandybuck, and Peregrin Took I might have known!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MERRY and PIPPIN are leaning over a barrel, washing dishe soapy water ... with GANDALF sitting nearby, smoking his and sipping an ale. Cries of “SPEECH! SPEECH!” erupt from the party. ANGLE ON: BILBO stepping on a stool ... he bows in gratit the applause.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Speech!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) My dear Bagginses and Boffins, Tooks and Brandybucks ... Grubbs, Chubbs, Burrowses, Hornblowers, Bolgers, Bracegirdles, Goodbodies, Brockhouses and Proudfoots...

dialogues.speaker: PROUDFOOT
dialogues.text: Proudfeet! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Proudfoots. Also my good Sackville-Bagginses that I welcome back at last to Bag End. ANGLE ON: OTHO and LOBELIA scowl at BILBO. He doesn’t car BILBO (CONT’D) Today is my one hundred and eleventh birthday. I am eleventy-one today! Yes, and alas ... Eleventy-one years is far too short a time to live among such excellent and admirable Hobbits! Tremendous outburst of approval! BILBO (CONT’D) I don't know half of you half as well as I should like, and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve! SCATTERED CLAPPING as the guests try to work out if that compliment or not. CLOSE ON: FRODO AND GANDALF smiling to themselves. CLOSE ON: BILBO ... a strange HUM seems to fill his head. of sweat rolls down his brow. BILBO’S hand pulls something out of his waistcoat pocket holds it behind his back. BILBO (CONT’D) I have ... things to do and I have put this off for far too long. CLOSE ON: BILBO’S knuckles turn white as he tightens his the small object behind his back. BILBO (CONT’D) I regret to announce this is the end. I am going now. I bid you all a very fond farewell! ! BILBO looks across at FRODO, hesitates... then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BILBO (CONT’D) (whisper) Goodbye. BILBO instantly vanishes. The party explodes into an upro the crowd leaps to its feet. ANGLE ON: FRODO staring at the empty stool in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAG END
dialogues.text: The party is still in an excited uproar ... some 50 yards as we PAN across a moonlit lane to the front door of BAG Door opens, pulled by an invisible hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BAG END
dialogues.text: The door quietly closes ... BILBO materializes as he pull plain gold ring off his finger. BILBO laughs as he tosses ring in the air, then places it in his pocket. ANGLE ON: BILBO emerges from the passage, carrying a walk stick. He finds GANDALF looming over him.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I suppose you think that was terribly clever?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Come on, Gandalf. Did you see their faces?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There are many magic rings in this world, Bilbo Baggins, and none of them should be used lightly.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: It was just a bit of fun. Oh, you’re probably right, as usual.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: You will keep an eye on Frodo, won't you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Two eyes. As often as I can spare them.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I'm leaving everything to him.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: What about this ring of yours? Is that staying too? CLOSE ON: BILBO ... he gives GANDALF a look and nods towa mantelpiece.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, it's in an envelope ... over there on the mantelpiece. GANDALF frowns at the empty mantelpiece ... BILBO suddenl his waistcoat with a look of guilty surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILBO (CONT’D) No, wait. It’s here in my pocket. Isn't that ... isn’t that odd, now? Yet, after all, why not? Why shouldn't I keep it?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I think you should leave the Ring behind, Bilbo. Is that so hard?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Well, no ... and yes. Now it comes to it, I don't feel like parting with it. It’s mine. I found it. It came to me! GANDALF LOOKS DOWN AT BILBO WITH RISING CONCERN.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There's no need to get angry.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Well, if I'm angry, it's your fault! It's mine. My own, my precious.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Precious? It's been called that before, but not by you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: What business is it of yours what I do with my own things? BILBO’S voice, shape and manner have suddenly changed.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I think you've had that ring quite long enough.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: You want it for yourself! GANDALF rises to his full height, his eyes flash, his sha suddenly seems to fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Bilbo Baggins, do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! BILBO cowers from GANDALF, disarmed by his power ... a frightened HOBBIT. GANDALF’S expression softens. GANDALF (CONT’D) I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you. Sobbing, BILBO runs to GANDALF and hugs him. GANDALF (CONT’D) All your long years we’ve been friends trust me as you once did. Let it go!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: You're right, Gandalf. The Ring must go to Frodo. BILBO lifts his knapsack and heads for the front door. BILBO (CONT’D) It's late, the road is long ... yes, it is time.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Bilbo?

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Hmmm? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: The Ring is still in your pocket. BILBO hesitates ... reaches into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. CLOSE ON: BILBO pulls out the ring ... he stares at it in palm. With all his will power, BILBO allows the ring to s slide off his palm and drop to the floor. CLOSE ON: The tiny ring lands with a heavy thud on the wo floor.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAG END
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BILBO staggering out of BAG END ... he braces h in the night air, PALE and TREMBLING, as if his loss of t has weakened him. GANDALF steps up behind.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I've thought up an ending for my book... “And he lived happily ever after to the end of his days.”

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I'm sure you will, my dear friend.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Gandalf.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Bilbo. BILBO walks away from BAG END, disappearing into the nigh softly singing: “The Road goes on and on.” GANDALF (CONT’D) (softly) Until our next meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE RING ... GLINTING on the floor ... GANDALF around it, a PUZZLED look on his face. GANDALF slowly rea for the RING. His fingers barely touch the RING ... the c HUM rises on the SOUNDTRACK. ANGLE ON: GANDALF is sitting in front of the fire, with h staring into the flickering flames.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's mine, my own, my precious.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (to himself) Riddles in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bilbo! Bilbo! FRODO rushes into BAG END ... he stops and picks up the R his feet. GANDALF continues staring into the fire, as if in thought.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (to himself) My precious ... precious...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (quietly) He's gone, hasn't he? FRODO steps into the living room. FRODO (CONT’D) He talked for so long about leaving I didn’t think he’d really do it.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (mutters to himself) ...my own.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Gandalf? GANDALF turns ... his eyes locking onto the RING in FRODO fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Bilbo’s ring. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF sorts hurriedly through BILBO’S papers. GANDALF (CONT’D) He's gone to stay with the Elves. He's left you Bag End... GANDALF holds out the envelope ... FRODO drops the RING i GANDALF (CONT’D) ...along with all his possessions. GANDALF seals the envelope with wax. He hands it to FRODO GANDALF (CONT’D) The ring is yours now. Put it somewhere out of sight. GANDALF rises hurriedly and starts to gather his things.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There are things I must to see to.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Questions. Questions that need answering.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: But you've only just arrived! I don't understand... GANDALF is already at the door, he turns to FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Neither do I. Keep it secret, Keep it safe. GANDALF hurries out the door ... leaving FRODO standing a BAG END. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA PUSHES IN ... THE HUM OF THE RING comes up on SOUNDTRACK. The CAMERA PUSHES through the white paper to RING ... beneath the HUM the whispered murmur of BLACK SP can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jagged ruins of BARAD-DUR. THE DARK TOWER! TEASING IMAGES: THE HUGE DARK TOWER OF BARAD-DOR is being rebuilt! Thousands of ORCS crawl over the surface, haulin and iron up the towering heights.

dialogues.speaker: GOLLUM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shire! Baggins!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINE BLACK RIDERS burst out of MINAS MORGUL and charge to CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: A LONE HORSEMAN gallops to the crest of a hill o west road. The main highway south to MINAS TIRITH ... he toward the saw-toothed mountains of MORDOR ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grows and spreads across the red streaked sky ... casting shadowy pall over the nightmarish landscape ... seeping o across the blood red sky... ANGLE ON: GANDALF, his face grave. He spurs his horse on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GANDALF making his way down into the lower dept the CITADEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Pages flipping as GANDALF searches ancient scro books placed high on a wooden table. His eyes settle on o parchment. He murmurs hurriedly to himself, reading.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (reading) The year 3434 of the Second Age here follows the account of Isildur High King of Gondor, and the finding of the Ring of Power.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (reading) It has come to me ... the Ring of Power! It shall be an heirloom of my kingdom ... all those who follow in my bloodline shall be bound to its fate, for I will risk no hurt to the ring ... it is precious to me, though I buy it with great pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF’S HAND.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (reading) The marking on the band begin to fade the writing which at first was as clear as red flame, has all but disappeared ... a secret now that only fire can tell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARMER MAGGOT is chopping wood in his garden. CLOSE ON: SNORTING HORSE NOSTRILS ... as the shadow of a RIDER looms over a HOBBIT HOUSE. Terrified, FARMER MAGGOT cowers in his doorway ... FANGS, dog, whimpers and backs away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLACK RIDER
dialogues.text: (hissing) Shire? Baggins?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER MAGGOT
dialogues.text: (terrified) There’s no Bagginses around here! They're all up in Hobbiton ... that way. THE BLACK RIDER GALLOPS AWAY AT SPEED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOBBITS of HOBBITON are having a grand evening of ale song. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN, mugs in hand, sing and dance table while supporting each other. ANGLE ON: FRODO retrieves more mugs of ale from the bar a dances around the tavern.

dialogues.speaker: HOBBITS
dialogues.text: (singing) Hey ho, to the bottle I go! To heal my heart and drown my woe. Rain may fall and wind may blow. But there still be - many miles to go! Sweet is the sound of the pouring rain, and the stream that falls from hill to plain. Better than rain or rippling brook -

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: is a mug of beer inside this Took! Huge laughter and clinking of mugs. ANGLE ON: DADDY TWOFOOT, TED SANDYMAN, and SAM’S father, GAMGEE (A.K.A. THE GAFFER), involve themselves in a most discussion. SAM sits quietly next to his father. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DADDY TWOFOOT
dialogues.text: There's been some strange folk crossing the Shire. Dwarves, and others of a less than savoury nature.

dialogues.speaker: TED SANDYMAN
dialogues.text: War is brewing. The mountains are fair teeming with goblins. SAM, smokes his pipe and looks at ROSIE behind the bar. She gives him a huge smile. He laughs

dialogues.speaker: GAFFER
dialogues.text: Far-off tales and children's stories, that's all that is. You're beginning to sound like that old Bilbo Baggins. Cracked, he was.

dialogues.speaker: TED SANDYMAN
dialogues.text: Young Mr. Frodo here, he's cracking! as FRODO arrives with drinks.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: And proud of it. Cheers, Gaffer.

dialogues.speaker: GAFFER
dialogues.text: Well, it's none of our concern what goes on beyond our borders. Keep your nose out of trouble, and no trouble'll come to you. FRODO smiles and raises his tankard. ROSIE COTTON bids the last of the PATRONS “Goodnight” . SAM meets her eyes for a moment as he and FRODO leave t inn.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Goodnight, lads.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Goodnight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO and SAM continue on their way. Behind them, an into HOBBIT kneels before ROSIE and raises his arms as if wors a goddess.

dialogues.speaker: INTOXICATED HOBBIT
dialogues.text: Goodnight, sweet maiden of the golden ale!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (muttering) Mind who you're sweet-talking.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Sam. Rosie knows an idiot when she sees one. SAM stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (worried) Does she?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAG END
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: FRODO FAREWELLS SAM outside BAG END, and heads t the front door. CREEPY POV FROM INSIDE BAG END: FRODO coming up the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO enters BAG END ... he immediately PAUSES, sensing that something is amiss. All is quiet ... FRODO p uneasily into the darkened living room. SUDDENLY! A large figure looms out of the shadows, reachi FRODO. FRODO lets out a startled cry, pulls himself free spins around to face his ASSAILANT. GANDALF steps into a shaft of moonlight. Paranoia blazes eyes. His clothes are dirty and ragged from much travelin and beard much longer and unkempt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) Is it secret? Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO pulls the envelope out of an old chest. GANDALF, suspcious, ALERT. Without a word, GANDALF takes the envelope and tosses it the fireplace!

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (bewildered) What are you doing? Flames instantly consume the envelope ... revealing the R it sinks into the red hot embers. GANDALF reaches into th with a pair of tongs ... he lifts the RING out.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Hold out your hand, Frodo ... it is quite cool. GANDALF drops the RING into FRODO’S hand ... he reacts to weight. GANDALF (CONT’D) What can you see? Can you see anything?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Nothing ... there's nothing. Wait... CLOSE ON: THE GOLD BAND of the RING as fiery letters begi appear ... a tiny inscription glows red ... as if burning within. FRODO (CONT’D) ...there are markings. CLOSE ON: GANDALF ... STILL ... TENSE. FRODO (CONT’D) It's some form of Elvish. I can't read it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (ominous) There are few who can ... the language is that of Mordor, which I will not utter here.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Mordor?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: In the common tongue, it says: “One Ring to rule them all. One Ring to find them. One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE RING lies on FRODO’S simple kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: This is the One Ring, forged by the Dark Lord Sauron, in the fires of Mount Doom ... taken by Isildur from the hand of Sauron himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (quiet realization) Bilbo found it ... in Gollum's cave.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Yes. For sixty years, the Ring lay quiet in Bilbo’s keeping, prolonging his life, delaying old age ... but no longer, Frodo. Evil is stirring in Mordor. The Ring has awoken. It's heard its master's call. AT THAT MOMENT: A FLEETING, LOW WHISPER OF BLACK SPEECH e from the RING. FRODO looks at GANDALF, each knowing the o has heard it.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: But he was destroyed ... Sauron was destroyed. ANGLE ON: THE RING lies between them on the table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No, Frodo. The spirit of Sauron endured. His life force is bound to the Ring and the Ring survived. Sauron has returned. His Orcs have multiplied ... his fortress of Barad-dar is rebuilt in the land of Mordor. Sauron needs only this Ring to cover all the lands in the second darkness. He is seeking it, seeking it, all his thought is bent on it. For the Ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its master: They are one, the Ring and the Dark Lord. Frodo, he must never find it. FRODO scoops up the RING.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO hurriedly entering the living room.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (thinking fast) We put it away, we keep it hidden! we never speak of it again. No one knows it’s here, do they? GANDALF shifts uncomfortably. FRODO (CONT’D) Do they, Gandalf? GANDALF looks at FRODO sadly...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There is one other who knew that Bilbo had the Ring. I looked everywhere for the creature Gollum, but the enemy found him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A TEASING GLIMPSE of GOLLUM being tortured by t ORCS. The wretched creature screams in pain.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I don't know how long they tortured him but amidst the endless screams and inane babble, they discerned two words.

dialogues.speaker: GOLLUM
dialogues.text: (screaming) S...Shire! Baggins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: FRODO’S HORRIFIED FACE!

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Shire! Baggins! That will lead them here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGE: On a dark country lane, a HOBBIT BOUNDER lifts his lantern in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: HOBBIT BOUNDER
dialogues.text: Halt! Who goes there? Out of the darkness thunder two BLACK RIDERS ... A LETHAL swings down at the small HOBBIT BOUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO thrusts the RING at GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Take it! Take it!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No, Frodo...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You must take it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You cannot offer me this ring.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I am giving it to you!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Don't tempt me, Frodo! I dare not take it, not even to keep it safe. THE RING IN FRODO’S HAND... GANDALF (CONT’D) Understand, Frodo ... I would use this Ring from a desire to do good ... but through me, it would wield a power too great and terrible to imagine.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: But it cannot stay in the Shire!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No, no, it can't. THE RING IN FRODO’S CLENCHED HAND.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What must I do?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. FRODO’S BEDROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO throwing clothes into a knapsack ... GANDALF watches him, making plans...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You must leave, and leave quickly. Get out of the Shire.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Where? Where shall I go?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Make for the village of Bree.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Bree? What about you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I will be waiting for you at the Inn of the Prancing Pony. FRODO packs his food into his knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: And the Ring will be safe there?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I don't know, Frodo. I don't have any answers. I must see the Head of my Order. He is both wise and powerful. Trust me, Frodo. He’1l1 know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO is preparing to leave.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You’1l have to leave the name of Baggins behind you ... for that name is not safe outside the Shire. GANDALF helps FRODO into his coat. GANDALF (CONT’D) Travel only by day. And stay off the road.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (thinking) I can cut across country easily enough. GANDALF looks at the young HOBBIT, moved by his courage.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: My dear Frodo. Hobbits really are amazing creatures. You can learn all there is to know about their ways ina month, and yet, after a hundred years, they can still surprise you. SUDDENLY! A SOUND from outside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF (CONT’D) Get down! GANDALF FREEZES ... he moves quietly towards the window, wide with tension. He raises his staff above the window, slams it down on the intruder. THERE IS A YELP OF PAIN! GANDALF hauls a small figure into the room ... SAM GAMGEE sprawls across the floor! He looks up in terror as GANDAL over him. GANDALF (CONT’D) (angry) Confound it all! Samwise Gamgee, have you been eavesdropping?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I ain’t been dropping no eaves, sir! Honest. I was just cutting the grass under the window there, if you follow me...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: It’s a little bit late for trimming the hedges, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I heard raised voices...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: What did you hear? Speak!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Nothing important ... that is, I heard a good deal about a ring ... and a Dark Lord. And something about the end of the world, but... Please, Mr. Gandalf, sir, don't hurt me! Don't turn me into anything unnatural!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No? FRODO SMILES. GANDALF (CONT’D) Perhaps not. I’ve thought of a better use for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: HOBBITON ... shrouded in a white veil of MIST. WIDER: To REVEAL GANDALF, FRODO, and SAM hurrying across ploughed field, away from HOBBITON! GANDALF leads his HOR FRODO and SAM are carrying knapsacks.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Come along, Samwise ... keep up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF leads FRODO and SAM under the cover of WOODS.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Be careful, both of you. The Enemy has many spies in his service, many ways of hearing ... birds, beasts... GANDALF takes FRODO to one side... GANDALF (CONT’D) (low voice) Is it safe? FRODO NODS ... he pats his pocket. GANDALF (CONT’D) Never put it on, for the agents of the Dark Lord will be drawn to its power... Always remember, Frodo, the Ring is trying to get back to its master ... it wants to be found. GANDALF wheels his horse and gallops away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: FRODO and SAM hike over the gentle Shire country . wading through a shallow stream ... pass by the quaint hollows of Hobbit Holes ... heating a kettle over a small . Clambering over stone walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM stops short back from where they came.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: This is what?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: If I take one more step, it’1l be the farthest away from home I've ever been. FRODO gives SAM a pat on the shoulder. SAM takes

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Come on, Sam. a deep breath and steps forward. SAM'S brown, furry foot hits the ground. FRODO IS SMILING. FRODO and

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Remember what Bilbo used to say ... it's a dangerous business... SAM continue their journey.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...it’s a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door ... you step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM cooks a dinner while FRODO relaxes in a tree, pipe. SUDDENLY, FRODO turns his head, listening. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: Singing ... high, sweet voices strange language. 46. taking stock of his surroundings. SAM looks

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: smoking his sing ina (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO looks at SAM with a delighted smile.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (whispers) Sam! Wood-Elves! ANGLE ON: A group of ELVES pass slowly through the forest on horseback, some walking, some with banners. The group to shine of its own light, their white garments softly gl against the purples and midnight blues of the woods. Thei haunting song continues.

dialogues.speaker: ELVEN VOICES
dialogues.text: (Elvish) a Galad ren i veniar hi' aladhremmin ennorath A Elbereth Gilthoniel ithil na th@1, ithil lin hen O Light to us that wander here Amid the world of woven trees! 0 Elbereth! Gilthoniel! Clear are thy eyes and bright thy breath! ANGLE ON: FRODO and SAM watching the procession from behi tree.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: They're going to the harbour beyond the White Towers. To the Grey Havens.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They're leaving Middle-earth.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Never to return.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know why ... it makes me sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO appears asleep. SAM tries desperately to find a comfortable spot on the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Everywhere I lie there’s a dirty great root sticking into my back. FRODO neither moves nor opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Just shut your eyes, and imagine you're back in your own bed, with a soft mattress and a lovely feather pillow. ANGLE ON: SAM looks skeptical, but tries it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (sighs) It's not working Mr. Frodo. I'm never going to be able to sleep out here.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Me neither, Sam. FRODO smiles. SAM stares at the sky and finds something t nibble on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: Mist descends over the peaceful Shire. TRACK BACK TO REVEAL: A horse neighs and stamps. Its BLAC comes slowly to a halt and looks for his prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient f of FANGORN. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant MOUNTAINS, the tall black tower of ORTHANC is clearly vis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF gallops through the gate, into the fortress of IS . a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enc beautiful trees and garden, watered by streams that flow from the mountains. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Smoke rises once more from the mountain of doom ... the Shadow takes shape in the darkness of Mordor; the hour grows late ... and Gandalf the Grey rides to Isengard seeking my council... The strange tower of ORTHANC ... hewn from a solid pillar obsidian ... rises up in the center of the ISENGARD CIRCL GANDALF arrives at he foot of the ORTHANC STAIRS. ANGLE ON: SARUMAN, THE WHITE WIZARD as he sweeps down the ORTHANC stairs.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: For that is why you have come, is it not, my old friend? GANDALF moves quickly towards him, grimy and weary from h ride.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Saruman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF and SARUMAN walk slowly between the beautiful tre ISENGARD. SARUMAN’S clean, white robe contrasts with GAND dusty grey robes.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Are you sure of this?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Beyond any doubt.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: So the Ring of Power has been found?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: All these long years, it was in the Shire, under my very nose.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Yet you did not have the wit to see it. Your love of the Halfling’s leaf has clearly slowed your mind. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: We still have time ... time enough to counter Sauron ... if we act quickly.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Time? What time do you think we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF and SARUMAN are seated in a small, cluttered room side of the cavernous central chamber.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Sauron has regained much of his former strength. He cannot yet take physical form ... but his spirit has lost none of its potency. Concealed within his fortress, the Lord of Mordor sees all. His gaze pierces cloud, shadow, earth and flesh. You know of what I speak, Gandalf ... a Great Eye, lidless, wreathed in flame.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (softly) The Eye of Sauron.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: He is gathering all evil to him. Very soon, he will have summoned an army great enough to launch an assault on Middle earth.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You know this? How?

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: I have seen it. GANDALF and SARUMAN stride through ORTHANC toward a stone on which a sphere like shape is draped with a cloth...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: A Palantir is a dangerous tool, Saruman. ANGLE ON: SARUMAN lifts the cloth to reveal the PALANTiR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Why? Why should we fear to use it?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: They are not all accounted for, the lost Seeing-stones. We do not know who else may be watching. GANDALF throws the cloth back over the PALANTIR.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH IMAGE
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SARUMAN sits on his throne.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: The hour is later than you think. Sauron’s forces are already moving... the Nine have left Minas Morgul.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (shocked) The Nine?

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: They crossed the River Isen on Midsummer's Eve, disguised as riders in black.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (alarmed) They have reached the Shire? SARUMAN shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: They will find the Ring ... and kill the one who carries it. GANDALF backs away and turns to run to the door ... horri the doors suddenly slam shut. SARUMAN (CONT’D) You did not seriously think a Hobbit could contend with the will of Sauron? There are none who can. GANDALF slowly turns to SARUMAN ... a look of dawning hor (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SARUMAN (CONT’D) Against the power of Mordor there can be no victory. We must join with him, Gandalf. We must join with Sauron. It would be wise, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (deadly) Tell me, friend, when did Saruman the Wise abandon reason for madness? AT THAT MOMENT: GANDALF is suddenly blasted across the ro slams againt the wall ... pinned there by some unseen for With sudden effort, GANDALF wrenches himself off the wall swings his staff on SARUMAN ... blasting him off his feet GANDALF and SARUMAN battle, powerful blasts throwing them the room. SARUMAN SCREAMS, EYES BLAZING! GANDALF’S staff is suddenl wrenched from his grasp ... it flies across the chamber i SARUMAN’S hand! GANDALF is flung to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: I gave you the choice of aiding me willingly, but you have elected the way of pain! GANDALF is breathing hard on the floor, his eye look into madness of SARUMAN... COMMANDING TWO STAFFS, SARUMAN sends GANDALF into a sicke spin. GANDALF tumbles towards the top of the chamber ... falling in reverse. RUSHING POV: the roof of ORTHANC rockets toward CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. FARMER’S FIELDS - DAY WIDE ON: FRODO and SAM walking along a country lane which borders FARMER MAGGOT’S FIELDS. ANGLE ON: SAM is looking up ... FRODO has disappeared aro corner in the lane. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (panicked) Mr. Frodo. Mr. Frodo! FRODO turns, surprised as SAM comes running towards him. SAM (CONT’D) (worried) I thought I'd lost you. ANGLE ON: FRODO looks at SAM suspiciously. ANGLE ON: SAM glances down, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (teasing) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (mumbling) It's just something Gandalf said...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He said...”“Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee.” (looks at Frodo intently) And I don't mean to.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (laughing) Sam ... we're still in the Shire what could possibly happen? SUDDENLY! A figure comes crashing out of a hedgerow sendi FRODO flying. FRODO picks himself up, only to be knocked down again by PIPPIN.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Frodo! Merry, it's Frodo Baggins.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Hello Frodo! ANGLE ON: MERRY, PIPPIN, and FRODO picking themselves up variety of vegetables have scattered everywhere. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What’s the meaning of this!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Sam, hold this... MERRY gives SAM a large cabbage.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You've been into Farmer Maggot's crop! ANGLE ON: A large pitchfork can be seen racing towards th along the HEDGEROW ... angry shouts from FARMER MAGGOT.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER MAGGOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s that in my field! Get out of it! Get out of my field, you young varmits! I’1l1 show you ... get out of my corn. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN hurriedly gather their booty a away ... with FRODO and SAM on their heels.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: I don't know why he is so upset, it's only a couple of carrots.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: And some cabbages ... and those three bags of potatoes that we lifted last week. And the mushrooms the week before.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Yes, Pippin, my point is, he's clearly overreacting. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: The BAYING OF LARGE DOG sounds!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO, SAM, and MERRY and PIPPIN tumble head over heel do bank, onto a dark, wooded road. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A winded PIPPIN, his face inches away from a la pile of HORSE droppings...

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: That was close. FRODO picks himself up and looks around quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (groaning) Ow ... I think I've broken something. He PULLS a LARGE CARROT, almost broken through in the mid out from his back pocket. MERRY (CONT’D) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (turning on Merry and Pippin) Trust a Brandybuck and a Took!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What? That was just a detour a short cut.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: A shortcut to what? PIPPIN has spied something under the trees on the far sid the road.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: (excited) Mushrooms! CLOSE ON: SMALL, brown mushrooms growing amongst the LOAM undergrowth. SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN race toward the mushr ANGLE ON: FRODO is tense and watchful. He realizes they a wooded road. Scattered leaves rise into the air WHIRLING the road as if blown by an invisible wind... SUDDENLY ... THE SOUND OF HORSE HOOVES...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I think we should get off the road. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A long drawn WAIL comes down the wind, like the cry of so and lovely creature. FRODO (CONT’D) (more urgency) Get off the road! SAM grabs MERRY and PIPPIN as the HOBBITS quickly scrambl the bank, hiding under a mossy log. THE SOUND OF HOOVES is close ... a sinister MOUNTED RINGW steps into view ... hooded and faceless, mounted on a hug snarling black horse with insane eyes! FRODO freezes in terror. ANGLE ON: The RINGWRAITH pauses right beside their hiding he sits very still with head bowed, listening. From insid the hood comes a sniffing noise as if he is trying to cat elusive scent: he head turning from side to side. CLOSE ON: FRODO ... beads of sweat gather on his brow ANGLE ON: The RINGWRAITH suddenly slides off his horse, l over the mossy log, peering suspiciously into the woods. CLOSE ON: FRODO ... he is drawing the RING out of his poc with trembling hands ... his face fevered and sweating as the grip of some terrible INTERNAL STRUGGLE. The SOUND OF SNIFFING intensifies as the RINGWRAITH darts head from side to side like a bird of prey. CLOSE ON: FRODO SQUEEZING HIS EYES SHUT...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Frodo? MERRY desperately hurls the mushrooms across the road ... RINGWRAITH spins around at the sound, and darts to the fa of the road with frightening speed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO instantly slumps ... as if a PSYCHIC LINK been broken...

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What was that? FRODO is staring, a look of shock on his face at the RING in the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN hurry through the trees slipping and sliding on the muddy ground.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What is going on? ANGLE ON: MERRY moves past PIPPIN, toward FRODO, watching intently ... SAM keeps looking around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: That Black Rider was looking for something ... or someone ... Frodo?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Get down! ANGLE ON: The SILHOUETTE OF A BLACK RIDER looms against t skyline. ANGLE ON: The FOUR HOBBITS ... sprawled on the ground, ho their breath. ANGLE ON: The BLACK RIDER turns and departs.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I have to leave the Shire. Sam and I must get to Bree. ANGLE ON: MERRY looks at his friend ... realizing FRODO i deep trouble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Right ... Buckleberry Ferry ... follow me! The HOBBITS break cover. SUDDENLY, A RINGWRAITH bursts out of the forest TOWARD TH MERRY (CONT’D) There’s another one!! Frodo, this way! ! The HOBBITS run ... THE RINGWRAITH SHRIEKS! QUICK CUTS: Black horse hooves ... snarling horse mouths fleeting black cowl. MERRY (CONT’D) Frodo, follow me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN are running towards the wid placid BRANDYWINE RIVER ... and the FERRY.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Get the ropes, Sam. QUICK ANGLES: STOMPING HOOVES ... SNARLING HORSES... Four RINGWRAITHS are speeding through the FOG ... converg the FERRY CROSSING. The HOBBITS stampede across the WHARF TUMBLE onto the FERRY.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (screaming) Frodo! FRODO races across the WOODEN WHARF, followed by the RINGWRAITHS. He leaps onto the FERRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM and MERRY shove off with the poles ... the ferry slid into the river, just as the RINGWRAITHS arrive. They pull the end of the wharf ... shrieking with rage! The HOBBITS their ears. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The RINGWRAITHS wheel their horses towards the north and away along the river bank, quickly disappearing into the

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Where is the nearest crossing?

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: The Brandywine bridge ... twenty miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Lights of BREE ... a small village of stone and timbered houses nestled against a low wooded hill. A thic surrounds the village ... a great gate bars the western entrance. CLOSE ON: FRODO, SAM, MERRY, AND PIPPIN approaching the gatehouse ... wild eyes, ragged, and out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Come on. ANGLE ON: A SURLY GATEKEEPER, OLD HARRY, glances down at

dialogues.speaker: OLD HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: We are headed for the Prancing Pony. OLD HARRY swings his lantern onto the HOBBITS, bathing th an uncomfortable yellow spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: OLD HARRY
dialogues.text: Hobbits! Four Hobbits, and what’s more, out of the Shire by your talk. What business brings you to Bree?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: We wish to stay at the inn ... our business is our own. To FRODO’S relief, OLD HARRY unlocks the gate.

dialogues.speaker: OLD HARRY
dialogues.text: All right, young sir, I meant no offense. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The HOBBITS gratefully enter BREE .. OLD HARRY eyeing the curiously in the lantern light.

dialogues.speaker: OLD HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘Tis Old Harry’s job to ask questions after nightfall. There's talk of strange folk abroad ... can't be too careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tall BREE FOLK loom over the nervous LITTLE HOBBITS a FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN make their way through the STREETS. Tall buildings tower above them ... light glow d from behind thick curtains. CLOSE ON: The sign of the “PRANCING PONY INN” ... FRODO, MERRY, and PIPPIN hurry toward it. INT. “PRANCING PONY” RECEPTION - NIGHT FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN come rushing in. FRODO attr the INN KEEPER’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERBUR
dialogues.text: Good evening, little masters. If you're seeking accommodation, we’ve got some nice, cozy Hobbit sized rooms available. Mr...ah...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Underhill ... my name's Underhill.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERBUR
dialogues.text: Underhill? Hmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: We're friends of Gandalf the Grey... Can you tell him we've arrived? BUTTERBUR frowns... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERBUR
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Gandalf ... Gandalf ... Oh... (recognition) Oh, yes! I remember ... elderly chap big grey beard ... pointy hat? BUTTERBUR shakes his head. BUTTERBUR (CONT’D) Not seen him for six months. FRODO is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (worried whisper ) What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: the noisy, smokey INN. It is dimly lit, shiefly blazing log fire ... and crowded with a mixture of BIG FO LOCAL HOBBITS, and a couple of dwarfs. ANGLE ON: FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN are sitting at a against the wall ... clearly trying to remain QUIET and inconspicuous ... SAM can’t help himself ... he keeps cas nervous glances around.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Sam, he'll be here. He’11 come. ANGLE ON: MERRY ploinks himself down at a table, carrying large mug of beer.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: This, my friend, is a pint.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: It comes in pints? I'm getting one. SAM watches PIPPIN rise unsteadily to his feet and head t bar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You've got a whole half already! MERRY watches PIPPIN go. ANGLE ON: A COUPLE OF SWARTHY MEN leaning against the bar at FRODO, then quickly look away. SAM (CONT’D) (tense) That fellow's done nothing but stare at you since we arrived. SAM indicates a BROODING STRANGER who sits alone at a tab the far corner, smoking a curiously carved long stemmed p peering from beneath a travel stained cowl with gleaming FRODO gestures to BUTTERBUR.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Excuse me, that Man in the corner, who is he?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERBUR
dialogues.text: He's one of them Rangers; they’re dangerous folk they are, wandering the wilds. What his right name is, I never heard, but round here he's known as Strider.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (to himself) Strider. BENEATH TABLE: FRODO’S fingers are nervously TOYING WITH RING. CLOSE ON: FRODO ... Sweat runs down his brow. The STRANGE THE RING spills into the SOUNDTRACK. “Baggins ... Baggins...” a creepy whisper seems to fill F head ... sound that dissolves into PIPPIN’S loud voice:

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Baggins? Sure I know a Baggins. He’s over there... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: PIPPIN sitting at the bar, chatting with LOCALS leaps to his feet and pushes his way to the bar. PIPPIN (CONT’D) Frodo Baggins. He's my second cousin, once removed on his mother's side and my third cousin, twice removed on his father’s side ... if you follow me. FRODO grabs PIPPIN’S sleeve, spilling his beer.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Pippin!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Steady on, Frodo! PIPPIN pushes FRODO away ... he stumbles backwards, and f the floor. AT THAT INSTANT, the INN goes silent and all the attentio to FRODO... CLOSE ON: THE RING ... in agonizing SLOW MOTION ... we wa it seems to hang in the air for a split second ... then c down onto his outstretched finger.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO VANISHES
dialogues.text: There is a sharp intake of breath followed by total silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RINGWRAITHS turn sharply in their saddles ... INSTANT aware that the RING is being worn. They spur their horses towards the distant lights of BREE. INT. “PRANCING PONY” INN - NIGHT SAM looks sick; PIPPIN instantly sobers, realizing his fo the brooding stranger frowns ... and the INN erupts into babble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TWILIGHT WORLD
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO, as he finds himself in the TWILIGHT WORL the RING: THE EXCITED CROWD are suddenly moving in SLOW M . distorted voices ... a weird photographic negative qual FRODO is moving in real time; against the slow motion background. He suddenly clutches his head as he is hit with QUICK IMA of a GREAT EYE! AN EVIL CAT-LIKE EYE, WREATHED IN FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF SAURON
dialogues.text: You cannot hide ... I see you : There is no life here in the void only cold ... only death. FRODO is terrified! He rolls under a table, desperately p the RING from his finger. FRODO MATERIALIZES into the REAL WORLD. AT THAT MOMENT: A LARGE HAND reaches under the table and FRODO by the collar, and DRAGS HIM AWAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO is roughly pushed against the wall. The BROODING ST looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: You draw far too much attention to yourself ... Mr. Underhill.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HOBBIT’S ROOM, PRANCING PONY - NIGHT FRODO is pushed into the HOBBIT’S ROOM by STRIDER.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: A little more caution from you ... that is no trinket you carry.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I carry nothing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Indeed? I can avoid being seen if I wish, but to disappear entirely ... that is a rare gift. He takes down the hood of his cloak to reveal a shaggy he dark hair flecked with grey, and in a pale stern face a p keen grey eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Are you frightened?
