dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Not nearly frightened enough. I know what hunts you. FRODO jumps at the sound of a noise in the corridor. STRI deftly draws his sword. ANGLE ON: The door BURSTS OPEN and SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN on the doorway. SAM is squaring off with his FISTS, MERRY brandishes a CANDELABRA, and PIPPIN a CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Let him go or I’1l have you, Longshanks! STRIDER SHEATHS his sword, a slight smile playing on his

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: You have a stout heart, little Hobbit, but that alone will not save you ... you can no Frodo. They’re coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD HARRY comes out of his LODGINGS with a lantern ... a fear on his face. He approaches the closed gate with grea apprehension. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: OLD HARRY peers out of his PEEPHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The gate crashes down on OLD HARRY ... aS FOUR RINGWRAITH into BREE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four RINGWRAITHS fly down the empty streets, like hor of the apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE: the front door FLIES OPEN. The FOUR RINGWRAITH into the PRANCING PONY with WICKED SWORDS DRAWN. CLOSE ON: BUTTERBUR hiding behind his bar ... trembling a sweating in TERROR. INT. HOBBIT’S ROOM, PRANCING PONY - NIGHT INSERT: MERRY SNORING SOFTLY ON HIS PILLOW. INSERT: PIPPIN stirs slightly, then settles back to sleep WIDE ON: The door creaks open ... THE FOUR RINGWRAITHS si slide into the HOBBIT’S ROOM. They LOOM over each bed, ra their SHINING SWORDS ABOVE THE SLEEPING HOBBITS. QUICK INSERT: SAM’S eyes open wide. In unison, the RINGWRAITHS STAB THE HOBBITS, in a SLASHIN HACKING FRENZY. INT. STRIDER’S ROOM - NIGHT ANGLE ON: STRIDER is grimly listening to the sounds from room. INT. HOBBIT’S ROOM, PRANCING PONY - NIGHT WIDE ON: the RINGWRAITHS step back from the slashed beds triumph. CLOSE ON: A hacked blanket is pulled back to reveal nothi a shredded pillow. The RINGWRAITHS SHRIEK WITH RAGE! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INSERT: SAM sits up with a start! CLOSE ON: Another shredded pillow is revealed! More SHRIE rage. INSERT: MERRY AND PIPPIN wake with a start.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STRIDER’S ROOM - NIGHT WIDE ON: SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN have been sleeping on STR bed. FRODO stands next to STRIDER by the window, peering nervously as furious RINGWRAITH screeches echo across the courtyard from the HOBBIT’S ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: They were once Men. ANGLE ON: STRIDER glances quickly at FRODO, then looks aw STRIDER (CONT’D) (quietly) Great kings of Men. Then Sauron the Deceiver gave to them Nine Rings of Power. Blinded by their greed they took them without question, one by one falling into darkness. Now they are slaves to his will. STRIDER looks from the window as the RINGWRAITHS gallop d BREE STREETS. CLOSE ON: STRIDER turns back to the HOBBITS, his face lit faintly by the GLOWING EMBERS of the FIRE. STRIDER (CONT’D) They are the NazgGl, Ringwraiths, neither living nor dead. At all times they feel the presence of the Ring drawn to the power of the One ... They will never stop hunting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STRIDER, MERRY, PIPPIN, AND FRODO march through gloomy overgrown forest. SAM follows at the rear leading SCRAWNY PONY, who is laden with supplies.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Where are you taking us?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Into the Wild. ANGLE ON: FRODO watches uneasily as STRIDER moves off int cover of trees...

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (whispered aside) How do we know this Strider is a friend of Gandalf?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I think a servant of the enemy would look fairer and feel fouler.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: He’s foul enough.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: We have no choice but to trust him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But where is he leading us? STRIDER stops, casts a glance back at SAM.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: To Rivendell, Master Gamgee ... to the house of Elrond. SAM looks excited.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, Bill? Rivendell! We're going to see the Elves! STRIDER leads the HOBBITS through the gloom of the forest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL ON: STRIDER leading FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN the windswept moor. ANGLE ON: The HOBBITS suddenly stop and unstrap their kna

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, we do not stop till nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What about breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: You’ve already had it.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: We've had one, yes ... what about second breakfast? ANGLE ON: STRIDER stares at PIPPIN blankly, then turns aw shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: I don't think he knows about second breakfast, Pip.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What about Elevenses, Luncheon, Afternoon tea, dinner ... he knows about them, doesn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't count on it. An apple is thrown to MERRY, who deftly catches it. Anoth aimed at PIPPIN, catches him on the forehead. MERRY (CONT’D) (exasperated) Pippin! ANGLE ON: The HOBBITS trudge through rain, looking tired, hungry, and miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: ARAGORN, FRODO, SAM, BILL, MERRY, and PIPPIN str through a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: muck. dense swampland. Bugs swarm around them. MERRY slaps at the swarming insects.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What do they eat when they can’t get Hobbit? PIPPIN loses his balance and falls face first into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full moon stands high overhead. STRIDER keeps a lone watch by the dying embers of the fire. He sings quietly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish) Tinuviel elvanui, Elleth alfirin ethelhael O hon ring finnil fuinui A renc gelebrin thiliol. Tinuiviel the elven-fair, Immortal maiden elven-wise, About him cast her night-dark hair, And arms like silver glimmering. FRODO awakens, hearing Strider’s song.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Who is she? This woman you sing of? STRIDER turns, momentarily startled. He relaxes quickly. He speaks as if the tale is personal to him.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: ‘Tis the lady of Luthien. The Elf-maiden who gave her love to Beren, a mortal.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What happened to her? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: She died. STRIDER sighs. His face bears remorse as he turns to FROD STRIDER (CONT’D) Get some sleep, Frodo. FRODO nods and lays back down. STRIDER turns back to his vigil and looks up at the moon. eyes are brimming with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARUMAN stands over the PALANT{R, his hands cupping the m eye.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: (whisper) The power of Isengard is at your command, Sauron, Lord of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: SAURON
dialogues.text: Build me an army worthy of Mordor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARUMAN is seated as his ORC OVERSEER approaches

dialogues.speaker: ORC OVERSEER
dialogues.text: What orders from Mordor, my lord? What does the Eye command?

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: We have work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: GANDALF ... lying unconscious on a cold obsidia floor. He wakes to the sound of ripping and tearing ... r onto his knees ... lifting his head (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF stands as the CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL HIM str on the SUMMIT OF ORTHANC. He is marooned on the tiny, fla surrounded on all sides by a sheer 500 FOOT DROP. Another whispering wail rends the air. GANDALF crosses qu to the edge and peers down: POV: One of the beautiful ISENGARD trees is being ripped the ground by the ORCS. GANDALF looks on in HORROR as ORC into the trunk with axes. ANGLE ON: SARUMAN stands in RAIN looking out into the dar the ORC OVERSEER sidles up to him, axe in hand, sweating with exertion.

dialogues.speaker: ORC OVERSEER
dialogues.text: The trees are strong, my Lord. Their roots go deep.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Rip them all down. CAMERA CIRCLES SUMMIT: MORE AND MORE TREES are hauled dow killed ... as GANDALF looks on in helpless despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The rugged countryside as the HOBBITS journey on by STRIDER. STRIDER stops before a distant hill, topped b ANCIENT RUIN.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: This was once the great Watchtower of Amon Sdl. We shall rest here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO, MERRY, and PIPPIN collapse into a small halfway up WEATHERTOP ... they are muddy and exhausted. ANGLE ON: STRIDER drops 4 SWORDS at the HOBBITS’ feet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: STRIDER (CONT’D) These are for you. Keep them close. I'm going to have a look around. Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: FRODO ... eyes flickering open. He suddenly sit sniffing the air. ANGLE ON: SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN huddled over a small fir SAUSAGES and BACON sizzle in a hot frying pan.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Tomatoes, sausages, and crispy bacon.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We saved some for you, Mr. Frodo.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Put it out, you fools! put it out!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice ... ash on my tomatoes!

dialogues.speaker: A SUDDEN SHRIEK
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FIVE RINGWRAITHS ON FOOT, running up the steep unnaturally fast.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Go! FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN clamber desperately towards summit, clutching their swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO, SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN race into a RING OF BROKEN on the summit on WEATHERTOP ... the ruined base of an anc tower. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The HOBBITS stand back-to-back in the centre of the RING, waiting for the first assault... ANGLE ON: One by one, the 5 RINGWRAITHS appear ... brandi GLEAMING SWORDS, they move slowly towards the HOBBITS. In center is their leader ... the WITCH KING!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Back, you devils! ANGLE ON: SAM rushes forward with a cry. He swings his sw the WITCH KING, who blocks the blow with his own sword. S blade shatters ... the WITCH KING lashes out with his fis sending SAM flying. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN, overcome with terror, throw themselves flat on the ground. ANGLE ON: The RINGWRAITHS close in on FRODO ... a VENOMOU WHISPER dances in his head... ANGLE ON: FRODO shuts his eyes and staggers back, despera resisting the WRAITH’S WHISPERINGS ... SLOW MOTION as his goes into his pocket and pulls out the RING. The 5 RINGWR utter a chilling SCREECH OF EXCITEMENT. FRODO is unable t resist any longer, falls to his knees and slips on the RI DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TWILIGHT WORLD
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO finds himself in the weird TWILIGHT WORLD looks upon the RINGWRAITHS, now visible in their TRUE APPEARANCE: FIVE GHOULS dressed in long GREY ROBES, with hair, and PALLID ruthless faces. THE WITCH KING extends a haggard hand towards FRODO, reac for the RING on his finger. FRODO’S trembling hand extend forward, as if by the pull of the RING ... he slides to t ground, unable to pull his hand away. The WITCH KING snarls and springs forward. He stabs at FR with a wicked DAGGER! FRODO winces as the tip of the dagg sinks into his shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, STRIDER charges at the RINGWRAITHS, wielding hi in one hand, a FLAMING TORCH in the other. He moves in SL MOTION, visible through a sea of mist. FRODO sinks to the ground. Behind him is a faint image of RINGWRAITH fleeing, his head engulfed in flames. With dra strength, FRODO manages to pull the RING off his finger.. IN THE REAL WORLD: ...APPEARING back in the real world, S rushes over to him. SAM (CONT’D) (horrified) Frodo! Another RINGWRAITH is burning and screaming ... others sc fearfully at the flames, turn and flee from the WEATHERTO SUMMIT. SAM (CONT’D) (panicked) Mr. Frodo!! STRIDER kneels before FRODO. He snatches up the WITCH KIN DAGGER from the ground, staring gravely at the long, thin blade. SAM (CONT’D) Help him, Strider!

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (grim) He's been stabbed by a Morgul blade. The MORGUL BLADE suddenly melts ... vanishing into the ai smoke. STRIDER throws the hilt down in disgust...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do something.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: This is beyond my skill to heal. (urgently) He needs Elvish medicine. STRIDER lifts FRODO onto his shoulders.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIDER is jogging grimly, carrying an ailing FRODO on hi SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN are running to keep up. The HOBBIT carrying FLAMING TORCHES for protection.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We are six days from Rivendell. FRODO groans.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Hold on, Frodo

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He’11 never make it! CLOSE ON: FRODO ... head lolling about, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (fevered calling) Gandalf ... Gandalf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE ... looking up at ORTHANC ... the TOWER OF ISEN gleaming in the moonlight. CAMERA RISES TO REVEAL the once beautiful gardens are now pitted wasteland ... with smoke and fire billowing out of numerous tunnels and vent holes that littler the forecour ORTHANC. Strange guttural chants echo up from deep underg THE CAMERA IS RISING ... a SMALL MOTH flutters into SHOT LEADS THE CAMERA towards the SUMMIT OF ORTHANC. GANDALF lies slumped against the wall at the very top of surrounded by a sheer 500 FOOT DROP. He looks WEAK and FR and is seemingly asleep. His hand suddenly moves at lightning speed and SNATCHES T MOTH. GANDALF brings his hand close to his face and opens The MOTH sits on the palm of his hand as GANDALF mutters words in a foreign tongue. CLOSE ON: THE MOTH’S face ... seemingly listening. It sud flutters away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS the MOTH off the ORTHANC SUMMIT, but drops the MOTH ... falling down, down, towards the pitted waste straight into a fiery red tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF SHOTS: The dead trees of ISENGARD are fed into furnaces ... molten metal pours into casts ... red hot me beaten by sweating ORC BLACKSMITHS ... armor and weapons forged from the great furnaces. ANGLE ON: SARUMAN strides among the ORCS and stands looki new born URUK-HAI as it escapes its birthing membrane ... is LURTZ, who rises up to stand before his master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: FRODO ... his eyes flicker open ... clouded, re rimmed ... his brow, beaded with sweat. FRODO’S POV: THREE LARGE STONE TROLLS sit in the clearing pops his head in front of FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Look, Frodo. It’s Mr. Bilbo’s trolls. ANGLE ON: SAM feels of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo? He's going cold!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Is he going to die? FRODO’S breathing is getting shallow. STRIDER loks out in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: He is passing into the Shadow World. He’11 soon become a Wraith like them. A DISTANT CRY of a RINGWRAITH carries through the air.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (nervous) They're close. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO gasps in sudden pain.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (thinking hard) Sam, do you know the Athelas plant? SAM looks blank.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Athelas?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Kingsfoil.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Kingsfoil. Aye. It's a weed.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: It may help to slow the poisoning. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM and STRIDER desperately search the dark forest floor ATHELAS PLANT. CLOSE ON: A small, white flowered plant! STRIDER drops to knee, carefully pulling it from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What is this? A Ranger caught off his guard? STRIDER slowly looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO is breathing hard, desperately ill. FRODO’S HALF-CONSCIOUS POV: Surreal impression ... a SHIM FIGURE IN WHITE leaps off a horse. FLASH INSERT: An ethereal vision of ARWEN, as she appears other side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Frodo, Im Arwen ... Telin let thaed. I am Arwen. I have come here to help you. (urgent) Lasto beth nin. Tolo dan na ngalad. Hear my voice. Return to the light.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (worried) Frodo?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She's an Elf. ARWEN who now appears in her earth bound form, a young ELVEN WOMAN with tousled hair, dressed in mud-splattered clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: He's fading. He's not going to last. We must get him to my father. STRIDER quickly lifts FRODO ... placing him on the horse.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Where are you taking him?

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you for two days. There are five Wraiths behind you. Where the other four are, I do not know.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Dartho guin Berian ... rych le ad tolthathon. Stay with the Hobbits. I will send horses for you. ARWEN grabbing the REINS of the horse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Hon mabathon. Rochon ellint im. I am the faster rider. I’1l take him. STRIDER clamps his hand over ARWEN’S.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Andelu i ven. The road is too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Frodo fir. Ae athradon i hir, tur gwaith nin beriatha hon. If I can get across the river, the power of my people will protect him.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What are they saying? CLOSE ON: ARWEN reaches for STRIDER’S hand ... looking de his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: I do not fear them. CLOSE ON: STRIDER ... we see that it is hard for him to l go.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Be iest lin. AS you wish. ANGLE ON: ARWEN mounts her horse, ASFALOTH... STRIDER (CONT’D) Arwen, ride hard. Don't look back. ANGLE ON: ARWEN looks down at STRIDER as she supports FRO one hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish) Noro lim, Asfaloth, noro lim! Ride fast, Asfaloth, ride fast!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Those wraiths are still out there! ANGLE ON: ASFALOTH springs away, bearing ARWEN and FRODO the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPEEDING POV: through the forest from the back of the WHI HORSE. ANGLE ON: FRODO, BOUNCING IN THE SADDLE, he lifts his hea weakly. SURREAL SLOW MOTION POV: THE HORSE’S HEAD BOBBING ... tre sliding by ... moonlight flickers through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: ETTENMOORS
dialogues.text: AERIAL: of ARWEN’S white horse emerging from the trees .. galloping across the open land as the sun rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASFALOTH charges through a PINE FOREST. Suddenly 2 GALLOPING RINGWRAITHS emerge from the trees be 2 more RINGWRAITHS slide in from different directions to the chase. ARWEN grits her teeth ... urges the white horse to greate speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white horse speeds out of the pine trees ... the 4 RINGWRAITHS close behind. PAN ONTO: 2 more RINGWRAITHS galloping down the hillside! AERIAL SHOT: 3 MORE RINGWRAITHS enter frame from differen directions ... a total of 9 RINGWRAITHS now pursuing FROD

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Panting head of the WHITE ELVEN HORSE.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: Noro lim, Asfaloth! Ride faster, Asfaloth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN: As the WHITE HORSE races toward CAMERA, to RE the wide river BRUINEN in the foreground. Without hesitation, the white horse leaps into the shallo and thunders across the Ford. The 9 RINGWRAITHS pulls up of the Ford, clearly nervous of the water. The white horse reaches the other side ... ARWEN pulls up turns to defiantly face the RINGWRAITHS from across the F

dialogues.speaker: WITCH KING
dialogues.text: Give up the halfling, She-Elf. She draws her sword and yells at the WITCH KING.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: If you want him, come and claim him. THE WITCH KING SCREECHES ANGRILY, draws his sword, and le RINGWRAITHS across the Ford. The water starts flowing fas a distant rumble can be heard. ARWEN waits until they are halfway across: she suddenly s in the saddle arms raised! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish) Nin o Chithaeglir, lasto Beth daer: Rimmo nin Bruinen, dan in Ulair! Nin o Chithaeglir, lasto beth daer, Rimmo nin Bruinen, dan in Ulair! Waters of the Misty Mountains, listen to the great word: flow waters of Loudwater, against the Ringwraiths!

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND SUDDENLY TREMBLES ... A MIGHTY ROAR FILLS THE
dialogues.text: FRODO looks up weakly ... to see a vast torrent of WATER flooding down the river towards the Ford ... as if a dam burst! ANGLE ON: The FOAMING WATER seems to form the shape of DA WHITE HORSES with frothing manes! The RINGWRAITHS screams terror as they are swallowed up in the deluge. Their pier cries are drowned in the roaring of the river as it carri away! CLOSE ON: FRODO as he loses consciousness...

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (upset ) No, no ... Frodo, no! Frodo, don't give in... not now! ARWEN gathers the small HOBBIT in her arms, feeling his l slip away. INT. FRODO’S DELIRIUM - DAY DELIRIOUS IMAGES AND SOUNDS...

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What grace is given me, let it pass to him. Let him be spared. Save him. IMAGES: A city in the woods ... A brief distorted glimpse ELROND - an ELVEN LORD - working feverishly to save FRODO (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: (Elvish) Lasto beth nin. Tolo dan na ngalad. Hear my voice, come back to the light IMAGES: A BLADE STABBING, over and over ... FRODO’S FACE, in FIRELIGHT ... the EYE OF SAURON looms toward FRODO! FR gasps at the EYE, his face twists with FEAR! IMAGE: A BRIGHT LIGHT suddenly flares ... FRODO squeezes eyes shut, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (frightened) Where am I? A FAMILIAR VOICE cuts through the swirl of sound.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You are in the House of Elrond, and it is ten o’clock in the morning on October the twenty-fourth, if you want to know. INT. FRODO’S BEDROOM - DAY FRODO’S eyes flicker OPEN ... He is lying in bed next to WINDOW ... DAPPLED sunlight plays on richly carved timber the sound of a nearby waterfall drifts through the VISTA TREES.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (weak relief) Gandalf! ANGLE ON: GANDALF IS SITTING NEXT TO FRODO’S BED ... soft puffing on his pipe. He smiles at FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm here. And you're lucky to be here too. A few more hours and you would have been beyond our aid. But you have some strength in you, my dear Hobbit. FRODO sits up, looking at GANDALF questioningly... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What happened, Gandalf? Why didn't you meet us?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I am sorry, Frodo. CLOSE ON: GANDALF ... troubled. His eyes drift away. GANDALF (CONT’D) I was delayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARUMAN stands over GANDALF, gloating...

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: A friendship with Saruman is not lightly thrown aside. With the power of his staff, SARUMAN tosses GANDALF from side of ORTHANC to off the edge of the other side where h GANDALF, suspended ... as if GANDALF is standing on the s the tower.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: One ill turn deserves another. It is over. Embrace the power of the Ring or embrace your own destruction! SARUMAN raises GANDALF again, then sends him crashing to floor.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There is only one Lord of the Ring. Only one who can bend it to his will . and he does not share power. SUDDENLY! GANDALF lurches to his feet and THROWS himself TOWER! SARUMAN watches GANDALF fly away from ISENGARD ... BACK of a GIANT EAGLE.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: (chilling) So you have chosen death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GWAIHIR THE WINDLORD soars majestically over the mountain carrying GANDALF towards the dawn.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. FRODO’S BEDROOM, RIVENDELL - DAY FRODO raises himself up and looks at GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Gandalf! What is it? GANDALF returns his attention to FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Nothing, Frodo... ANGLE ON: SAM runs to FRODO’S bedside. He is overjoyed to FRODO awake.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Frodo! Frodo! Bless you, you’re awake!!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Sam has hardly left your side.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We were worried about you -- weren't we, Mr. Gandalf?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: By the skills of Lord Elrond, you’re beginning to mend. ANGLE ON: ELROND, LORD OF THE HIGH ELVES, steps up to FRO bedside .. his face is neither old nor young, though in i written the memory of many things both glad and sorrowful

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Welcome to Rivendell, Frodo Baggins. FRODO sits up, looking at ELROND with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: RIVENDELL ... a small cluster of elegant ELVEN BUILDINGS sitting in a Shangri-la like VALLEY below tower cliffs and snow capped mountains.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have found your way to the last homely house east of the sea. The Elves of Imladris have dwelt within this valley for 3,000 years though few of my kin now remain. ANGLE ON: FRODO looks out from his balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO and SAM walk together. Suddenly, the voices of MERR PIPPIN can be heard as they bound up to FRODO and throw t arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Frodo! Frodo! SAM looks past FRODO smiling ... a bent figure sits alone bench, in the SUN. CLOSE ON: FRODO turning, following SAM’S gaze...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Bilbo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: BILBO BAGGINS! He breaks into a broad grin as F rushes forward to embrace him. BILBO has aged significant since we last saw him.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Hello, Frodo, my lad!

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Bilbo! LATER ... FRODO is turning the neatly inscribed title pag red leather bound journal: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO (CONT’D) “There and Back Again: A Hobbit's Tale” by Bilbo Baggins. BILBO smiles PROUDLY. He is sitting with FRODO on a terra overlooking a WATERFALL. FRODO looks at PAGE AFTER PAGE o beautiful HANDWRITING, with intricate MAPS and DRAWINGS. FRODO (CONT’D) This is wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: I meant to go back ... wander the paths of Mirkwood, visit Laketown, see the Lonely Mountain again ... but age, it seems, has finally caught up with me. FRODO turns a page ... there before him, is a map of the

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (quietly) I miss the Shire ... I spent all my childhood pretending I was off somewhere else ... off with you, on one of your adventures... (looks at Bilbo) But my own adventure turned out to be quite different ... I'm not like you, Bilbo.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: My dear boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM busily tries to stuff more and more things into his a full pack ... pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Now, what have I forgotten? PULL BACK TO REVEAL: FRODO, hands in his pockets, watchin

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Packed already? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAM looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (slightly embarrassed) No harm in being prepared. FRODO strolls to the edge of the BALCONY.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted to see the Elves, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I do...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: More than anything.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I did. It’s just... We did what Gandalf wanted, didn't we? We got the Ring this far, to Rivendell ... and I thought ... seeing as how you're on the mend, we'd be off soon. Off home.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You're right, Sam... FRODO looks at SAM... FRODO (CONT’D) ...we did what we set out to do. CLOSE ON: FRODO opens his hand, the RING sits in his PALM FRODO (CONT’D) The Ring will be safe in Rivendell. I am ready to go home.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ELROND’S CHAMBER, RIVENDELL - DAY GANDALF and ELROND watch FRODO and SAM from ELROND’S balc

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: His strength returns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: That wound will never fully heal. He will carry it the rest of his life.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Yet to have come so far still bearing the Ring ... the Hobbit has shown extraordinary resilience to its evil.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: It is a burden he should never have had to bear. We can ask no more of Frodo.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Gandalf, the enemy is moving. Sauron's forces are massing in the East. His Eye is fixed on Rivendell. And Saruman, you tell me, has betrayed us. Our list of allies grows thin.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: His treachery runs deeper than you know. By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orcs with Goblin Men ... He’s breeding an army in the caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in Sunlight and cover great distance at speed. Saruman is coming for the Ring. ELROND turns and walks away...

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: This evil cannot be concealed by the power of the Elves... We do not have the strength to fight both Mordor and Isengard ... Gandalf ... the Ring cannot stay here. GANDALF turns and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of arrivals ... GANDALF watches as BOROMIR rides through the RIVENDELL gate, followed by LEGOLAS and ELROND (V.0.) (CONT’D) This peril belongs to all Middle-Earth. They must decide now how to end it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: ELROND approaches GANDALF. ELROND (V.0.) (CONT’D) The time of the Elves is over. My people are leaving these shores. Who will you look to when we’ve gone? The Dwarves? They hide in their mountains seeking riches. They care nothing for the troubles of others.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: It is in Men that we must place our hope.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Men? Men are weak. The race of Men is failing. The blood of Numenor is all but spent, its pride and dignity forgotten. It is because of Men the Ring survives. FLASH INSERT: With the broken sword, ISILDUR slices off S finger. ELROND reacts. ELROND (V.0.) (CONT’D) I was there, Gandalf. I was there three thousand years ago when Isildur took the Ring.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCED.
dialogues.text: ELROND (V.0.) (CONT’D) I was there when the day the strength of Men failed.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Isildur ... hurry ... follow me! IMAGES: ELROND leads ISILDUR into the steaming volcano. ELROND (V.0.) (CONT’D) I led Isildur into the heart of Mount Doom, where the Ring was forged: the one place it could be destroyed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Cast it in the fire ... destroy it! CLOSE ON: ISILDUR ... CAPTIVATED BY THE RING.

dialogues.speaker: ISILDUR
dialogues.text: No. ISILDUR turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Isildur!! INT. ELROND’S CHAMBER, RIVENDELL - DAY ANGLE ON: ELROND turns to GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: It should have ended that day, but evil was allowed to endure. Isildur kept the Ring ... and the line of kings was broken. There’s no strength left in the world of Men. They are scattered, divided, leaderless.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There is one who could unite them, one who could reclaim the throne of Gondor.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: He turned from that path a long time ago. He has chosen exile.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ELROND’S CHAMBER, RIVENDELL - NIGHT ANGLE ON: STRIDER watches from the shadows ... as BOROMIR strolls through the darkened gallery. BOROMIR’S eyes are to an old FRESCO on the wall ... depicting ISILDUR defeat SAURON. BOROMIR turns suddenly and notices STRIDER, looking at hi looks STRIDER up and down, confused for a moment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: You are no Elf.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: Men of the South are welcome here.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: I am a friend to Gandalf the Grey. BOROMIR nods, understanding Strider’s vagueness.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Then we are here on common purpose friend. BOROMIR smiles uncomfortably. STRIDER only looks at him silently. BOROMIR looks with WONDERMENT at NARSIL, the BROKEN BLADE ELENDIL, which lies on a cloth-covered plinth. BOROMIR (CONT’D) (quiet awe) The shards of Narsil ... the blade that cut the Ring from Sauron's hand. BOROMIR picks up the sword and gently touches the blade. CLOSE ON: a small bloom of blood appears on BOROMIR’S finger... BOROMIR (CONT’D) Still sharp. He slowly looks over to STRIDER, as if sensing a connecti BOROMIR (CONT’D) But no more than a broken heirloom. BOROMIR replaces the blade, but it clatters to the floor. BOROMIR walks away, leaving STRIDER sitting alone. CLOSE ON: STRIDER picks up the broken hilt, as ARWEN appe behind him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: Why do you fear the past? You are Isildur's heir, not Isildur himself. You are not bound to his fate.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: The same blood flows in my veins the same weakness...

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: Your time will come. You will face the same evil. And you will defeat it. (Elvish: with subtitles) A si i-Dhuath u-orthor, Aragorn. U or le a G or nin. The shadow does not hold sway yet Not over you and not over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night falls upon the beautiful valley of RIVENDELL ... st and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIDER and ARWEN stand together upon a stone bridge ... EVENSTAR at ARWEN’S breast shines in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Renech i lu i erui govannen? Do you remember when we first met?

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Nauthannem i ned ol reniannen. I thought I had strayed into a dream. ARWEN reaches up and gently touches the GREY at STRIDER’S temples. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Gwenwin in enninath. U-arnech in naeth i si celich. Long years have passed. You did not have the cares you carry now. ARWEN looks into STRIDER’S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Renech i beth i pennen? Do you remember what I told you? ARWEN reaches for STRIDER’S hand...

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (quietly) You said you would bind yourself to me, and forsaking immortal life of your people.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: (whisper) And to that I hold. I would rather share one lifetime with you than face all the Ages of this world alone. CLOSE ON: STRIDER looks down. In his hand lies the EVENST

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I choose a mortal life.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: You cannot give me this.

dialogues.speaker: ARWEN
dialogues.text: It is mine to give to whom I will, like my heart. ARWEN closes STRIDER’S fingers around the jewel. ARWEN leans towards STRIDER, gently kissing him.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES from the PROLOGUE: the RINGS being given to the EL DWARVES, and MEN.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all. One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all together and in the darkness bind them, In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. CLOSE ON: FRODO opens his hand ... the RING lies in his p looks up. ANGLE ON: ELROND addresses the COUNCIL...

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Strangers from distant lands friends of old. You have been summoned here to answer the threat of Mordor. Middle-Earth stands upon the brink of destruction. None can escape it. You will unite ... or you will fall. Each race is bound to this fate ... this one doom... FRODO sits amongst a council of FREE-PEOPLES of Middle ea ELROND stands before them, addressing GANDALF, STRIDER, L and 20 other ELVES, DWARVES, and MEN. ELROND (CONT’D) Bring forth the Ring, Frodo. ANGLE ON: FRODO steps forward and moves towards a stone P He places the RING on the plinth and returns to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (shocked) So it is true! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (disbelief) Sauron’s Ring! The Ring of Power!

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (grim) The doom of man! ON THE SOUNDTRACK: The HUM of the RING sounds. ANGLE ON: Several members of the COUNCIL take notice. BOR stands and begins to approach the RING, as if drawn to it

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: In a dream, I saw the eastern sky grow dark, but in the West a pale light lingered. A voice was crying: “Your doom is near at hand. Isildur’s Bane is found.” ANGLE ON: ELROND and GANDALF exchange glances. BOROMIR re for the RING.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Isildur’s Bane.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: (standing) Boromir ! ANGLE ON: GANDALF stands and speaks in the BLACK TONGUE. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: The RING responds to GANDALF. ANGLES ON: BOROMIR staggers back to his chair ... the sky darkens ... thunder rolls ... the ground trembles...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (Black Speech) Ash nazg durbatuldk ash nazg gimbatul, ash nazg thrakatuldk agh burzum-ishi krimpatul. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the Darkness bind them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nature returns to normal. ELROND looks to GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: (sternly) Never before has any voice uttered the words of that tongue here in Imladris.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I do not ask your pardon, Master Elrond, for the Black Speech of Mordor may yet be heard in every corner of the West! The Ring is altogether evil. ANGLE ON: GANDALF returns to his seat. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR shakes his head. He stands again to mak case to the COUNCIL.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: It is a gift ... a gift to the foes of Mordor! Why not use this Ring? Long has my father, the Steward of Gondor, kept the forces of Mordor at bay ... by the blood of our people are your lands kept safe. Give Gondor the weapon of the enemy ... let us use it against him!

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: You cannot wield it. None of us can. The One Ring answers to Sauron alone . it has no other master. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR turns and looks at STRIDER, coolly.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: And what would a Ranger know of this matter? STRIDER says nothing and BOROMIR turns away dismissively. ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS stands...

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: This is no mere Ranger. He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn. You owe him your allegiance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO looks at STRIDER questioningly ... BOROMI sharply.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (quiet disbelief) Aragorn? This is Isildur's heir?

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: And heir to the throne of Gondor.

dialogues.speaker: STRIDER
dialogues.text: (Elvish: with subtitles) Havo dad, Legolas... Sit down, Legolas...

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Gondor has no king.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Aragorn is right ... we cannot use it.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: You have only one choice ... the Ring must be destroyed. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: The HUM OF THE RING seems to grow loud FRODO’S ears. ANGLE ON: GIMLI suddenly stands, excited.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Then ... what are we waiting for? GIMLI suddenly rushes forward! He swings his axe down on RING. The axe SHATTERS with a deafening CRACK! GIMLI fall backwards staring in disbelief at the RING ... unharmed! ANGLE ON: FRODO winces as an angry IMAGE of the FIERY EYE him! He slumps in his chair, clutching his forehead. GAND looks at him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: The Ring cannot be destroyed, Gimli, son of Gldéin, by any craft that we here possess. The Ring was made in the fires of Mount Doom ... only there can it be unmade. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELROND (CONT’D) It must be taken deep into Mordor, and cast back into the fiery chasm from whence it came. One of you must do this. STUNNED SILENCE ... the council sits with downcast eyes, great dread has descended upon them. BOROMIR addresses the council in a quiet voice.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: One does not simply walk into Mordor. Its Black Gates are guarded by more than just Orcs. There is evil there that does not sleep and the Great Eye is ever watchful. It is a barren wasteland riddled with fire, and ash and dust ... the very air you breathe is a poisonous fume. Not with ten thousand Men could you do this. It is folly.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Have you heard nothing Lord Elrond has said? The Ring must be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: And I suppose you think you're the one to do it?

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: And what if we fail, what then? what happens when Sauron takes back what is his? GIMLI leaps to his feet!

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: I will be dead before I see the Ring in the hands of an Elf! A STORM OF ARGUMENT erupts around the room. CLOSE ON: FRODO ... sound disappears as he watches in SLO MOTION ... the angry faces, the shaking fists, the accusa fingers, his eyes move to the RING ... THE HUM grows loud his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIMLI (CONT’D) (shouting) Never trust an Elf! CLOSE ON: THE RING fills the screen ... streams of blood across the surface ... flames flicker within the GOLD BAN

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Do you not understand? While we bicker amongst ourselves, Sauron’s power grows! No one will escape it. You will all be destroyed, with your homes burnt and your families put to the sword! CLOSE ON: FRODO ... breathing rapidly, CAUGHT in the grip hideous vision. With a huge effort of will, FRODO tears h upon the RING. ANGLE ON: FRODO suddenly stands ... he speaks in a strong voice.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I will take it ... I will take it I will take the Ring to Mordor. SUDDEN SILENCE ... FRODO looks around the room at the ast faces. FRODO (CONT’D) (quietly) Though I do not know the way. ANGLE ON: GANDALF rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I will help you bear this burden, Frodo Baggins, as long as it is yours to bear.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: If by my life or death I can protect you, I will. (kneels before Frodo) ...you have my sword. ARAGORN steps forward ... followed by LEGOLAS and GIMLI.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: And you have my bow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: And my axe. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR looks at them all and then walks to FRO

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: You carry the fates of us all, little one. BOROMIR looks towards ELROND and GANDALF. BOROMIR (CONT’D) If this is indeed the will of the Council, then Gondor will see it done. ANGLE ON: FRODO stares in wonder as the GREATEST FIGHTERS Middle earth stand at his side.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (unseen) Here! A SUDDEN NOISE ... SAM pops up from behind a BUSH!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo's not going anywhere without me.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: No, indeed ... it is hardly possible to separate you ... even when he is summoned to a secret Council and you are not. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN jump up from behind another bu

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Oi! We're coming too! You'd have to send us home tied up in a sack to stop us.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Anyway ... you need people of intelligence on this sort of mission ... quest thing...

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Well, that rules you out, Pip. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Nine companions ... so be it. (announcing) You shall be the FELLOWSHIP OF THE RING.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Great. Where are we going? EXT. GILRAEN’S MEMORIAL, RIVENDELL - DAWN 103.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A HAND gently and reverently removes debris fro base and form of a STATUE ANGLE ON: The STATUE OF GILRAEN’S hands are folded before and her head is hooded. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN stands back and gazes into her sad face

dialogues.speaker: ELROND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Elvish; with subtitles) Anirne hene beriad i chén in. Ned Imladris nauthant e le beriathar aen. She wanted to protect her child. She thought that in Rivendell you would be safe. ANGLE ON: ELROND approaches ARAGORN. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN pays little attention to ELROND. the face of his MOTHER’S STATUE. ANGLE ON: ELROND approaches from behind ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: In her heart, your mother knew you’d be hunted all your life. That you’d never escape your fate. The skill of the Elves can reforge the sword of kings, but only you have the power to wield it. He caresses (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: ARAGORN TURNS to him.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: I do not want that power. I have never wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: You are the last of that bloodline. There is no other. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN stands silently and continues looking u STATUE. INT. FRODO’S BEDROOM, RIVENDELL - DAWN CLOSE ON: AN OLD SWORD sliding out of a shabby leather SCABBARD... Its polished, well tendered BLADE glitters CO BRIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: My old sword “Sting” ... here, take it! BILBO offers STING to FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: It's so light!

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, made by the Elves, you know. The blade glows blue when Orcs are close ... and it’s times like that, my lad, when you have to be extra careful. BILBO unwraps a SMALL SHIRT OF CLOSE WOVEN MAIL.

dialogues.speaker: BILBO
dialogues.text: Here’s a pretty thing. Mithril, as light as a feather, and as hard as dragon scales. Let me see you put it on. Come on. CLOSE ON: FRODO peels off his SHIRT ... revealing the RIN the CHAIN around his neck. BILBO (CONT’D) (entranced) Oh! My old Ring... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO frowns as BILBO moves toward him. BILBO (CONT’D) I should very much like to hold it again, one last time. BILBO reaches forward, eyes locked on the RING. ANGLE ON: SUDDENLY! A SHADOW passes across BILBO ... for second he becomes a WRINKLED CREATURE with a HUNGRY FACE BONY, GROPING HANDS. ANGLE ON: FRODO pulls away, shocked... ANGLE ON: THE SHADOW passes... BILBO slumps into a chair, head in his hands. BILBO falters ... his eyes filling wit tears. BILBO (CONT’D) Oh! (sad) I'm sorry, that I brought this upon you, my boy. I'm sorry that you must carry this burden. I'm sorry for everything. BILBO sobs and FRODO moves to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: ELROND and FRODO walk towards the rest of the FELLOWSHIP waiting at the Gate of RIVENDELL.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: The time has come for the Ring to set out. You cannot count on your journey being aided by war or force. You will pass into the domain of the Enemy far from aid. Do you still hold to your word Frodo, that you will be the Ring-bearer?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I do. I must. I will go with Sam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Then I cannot help you much, not even with counsel. I can foresee very little of your road; and how your task is to be achieve Mountains, and draws nigh even to the borders of the Greyflood; and under the Shadow all is dark to me. You will meet many foes, some open, and some disguised; and you may find friends upon your way when you least look for it. I will send out messages, such as I can contrive, to those whom I know in the wide world; but so perilous have the lands now become that some may well miscarry, or come no quicker than you yourself. Had I a host of Elves in armor of the Elder Days, it would avail little, save to arouse the power of Mordor. Are you confident in your companions?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Yes, Lord Elrond. I must be, I’m afraid, for if I doubt them, we may never succeed.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: And what of your Hobbit friends? I had hoped to send them back to the Shire as messengers to warn the people of the impending danger according to the fashion of your country. I feel that the youngest, Peregrin Took, should not go with you. My heart is against it.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: His heart is set upon going. There will be no stopping him, even if you did send him home in a sack.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: Let it be so then. The Fellowship awaits. WIDE ON: ELROND and FRODO turn a corner and descend to th FELLOWSHIP, now waiting by the gate.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO joins the FELLOWSHIP, ready to depart. Th set to go on foot with only SAM’S PONY, BILL, to carry mu their baggage. ANGLE ON: ELROND stands with the ELVES, addressing their hope of success.

dialogues.speaker: ELROND
dialogues.text: The Ring-bearer is setting out on the Quest of Mount Doom. On you who travel with him, no oath nor bond is laid to go further that you will. Farewell. Hold to your purpose. May the blessing of Elves and Men and all Free Folk go with you.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: The Fellowship awaits the Ring-bearer. ANGLE ON: FRODO slowly turns to the FELLOWSHIP and timidl his way to the head of the GROUP. FRODO’S POV: The faces of those who vowed to follow him w he makes his way to lead the FELLOWSHIP. ANGLE ON: FRODO leads the FELLOWSHIP out of RIVENDELL. He to GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Mordor, Gandalf, is it left or right? ANGLE ON: GANDALF continues looking ahead.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Left. ANGLE ON: GANDALF places his hand on Frodo’s left shoulde FELLOWSHIP follows FRODO into the Middle-Earth. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN turns to bid a silent farewell. ANGLE ON: ARWEN stands in a group of ELVES, watching him. ANGLE ON: He nods to her and follows the FELLOWSHIP out.
ANGLE ON: The FELLOWSHIP climbs the long steep path out o cloven vale of RIVENDELL.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The FELLOWSHIP trekking through a land of DEEP and turbulent water ... The MISTY MOUNTAINS rise sharply their left.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We must hold to this course, west of the Misty Mountains, for forty days. If our luck holds, the Gap of Rohan will still be open to us. From there, our road turns east, to Mordor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: SAM at the CAMPFIRE. The SOUND OF CLASHING SWOR WIDER: ARAGORN and BOROMIR are giving PIPPIN SWORD TUITIO

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Get away from the blade, Pippin ... on your toes ... good, very good ... I want you to react, not think.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Should not be too hard...

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Move your feet.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Quite good, Pippin.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Thanks. CLOSE ON: GIMLI has managed to corner GANDALF... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: If anyone were to ask for my opinion, which I note they have not, I would say we are taking the long way round. Gandalf, we can pass through the Mines of Moria. My cousin, Balin, would give us a royal welcome. ANGLE ON: GANDALF clearly thinks this is a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No, Gimli. I would not take the road through Moria unless I had no other choice. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR thrusts, catching PIPPIN on the hand. P throws down his SWORD, KICKS and LUNGES at BOROMIR, tackl o the ground. Much laughter. ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS’ EYES are fixed on a DISTANT DARK PATCH darts about in the sky, like flying smoke in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Nothing ... it’s just a wisp of cloud.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (worried) It's moving fast ... against the wind.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Crebain from Dunland!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (urgently) Hide!

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Merry ... Pippin ... Sam ... take cover! WIDE ON: THE FELLOWSHIP scramble under what little cover is ... as a regiment of LARGE CROWS fly overhead at GREAT wheeling and circling above. As their dark shadow passes the FELLOWSHIP a single harsh CROAK is heard...and the CR suddenly wheel away, back towards the SOUTH. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GANDALF staggers to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Spies of Saruman. The passage south is being watched. GANDALF looks at ARAGORN, turns to the others...gestures a high mountain pass. GANDALF (CONT’D) We must take the Pass of Caradhras!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The FELLOWSHIP clamber through ROCK and SNOW. CLOSE ON: FRODO slips on some SHALE ... as he scrambles t feet, the RING falls on the ground. CLOSE ON: The RING gleaming in the snow! BOROMIR’S HAND p up by the CHAIN. ANGLE ON: He stands, the RING dangling before his eyes. H to grow in stature, as if absorbing its power. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN warily approaches BOROMIR. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR is motionless ... he stares at the RING transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Boromir?

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: It is a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing ... such a little thing.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Boromir ... give the Ring to Frodo. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN’S HAND moves to his sword hilt. RING’S POV: Looking at BOROMIR’S face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON THE SOUNDTRACK: The strange HUM VIBRATES. CLOSE ON: A WEIRD BEATIFIC SMILE lights up on BOROMIR’S f The HUM grows to a deafening roar! BOROMIR suddenly snaps of his trance and hands the RING to FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (lightly) As you wish. I care not. BOROMIR smiles at FRODO, ruffling his hair. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN unhands his SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following the CROWS as they race deeper and deeper, passi vista of INDUSTRY, HUNDREDS OF ORCS and writhing BIRTHSAC flying past SARUMAN, who stands upon a wooden GANTRY. CLOSE ON: SARUMAN, listening to the CRIES of the CROws.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: So, Gandalf ... you try to lead them over Caradhras. And if that fails where then will you go? INSERT IMAGE: The FELLOWSHIP struggles through the SNOW o CARADHRAS . SARUMAN (V.0.) (CONT’D) If the mountain defeats you, will you risk a more dangerous road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FELLOWSHIP are struggling through a blinding blizzard towards the PASS OF CARADHRAS. ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS the ELF moves lightly across the top of snow ... he suddenly pauses. SARUMAN’S VOICE sweeps by on wind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (chanting; subtitled) Cuiva nwalca Carnirasse; nai yarvaxea rasselya! Wake up cruel Redhorn! May your horn be bloodstained!

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (urgent) There is a fell voice on the air.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: It’s Saruman! THUNDER RUMBLES ... ROCK and SHALE fall from above.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (urgently) He's trying to bring down the mountain. Gandalf! We must turn back!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No! GANDALF RAISES HIS STAFF ... HE CHANTS INTO THE WIND.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (yelling) Losto Caradhras, sedho, hodo, nuitho i ruith. Sleep, Caradhras, be still, lie still, hold your wrath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWEEPS PAST SARUMAN ... he stands on the PINNACLE ORTHANC, CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Cuiva nwalca Carnirasse; Nai yarvaxea rasselya; taltuva notto-carinnar! Wake up cruel Redhorn! May your bloodstained horn fall upon enemy heads! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOUDS ARE FLOWING FROM ALL DIRECTIONS ... converging on distant mountains in a stormy MAELSTROM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARUMAN’S voice strengthens ... rolling past the FELLOWSH THUNDER. A LIGHTNING CRACK explodes on the mountainside a them. ANGLE ON: FRODO looks up in HORROR as a huge snow avalanc thunders down towards them! ANGLES ON: LEGOLAS pulls GANDALF to safety. ARAGORN shiel FRODO and SAM as snow piles around them. Within moments, PASS is blocked and the FELLOWSHIP are enveloped in snow. BOROMIR and ARAGORN frantically dig for the HOBBITS ... w pulled out SHIVERING and FEARFUL.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (urgent) We must get off the mountain! Make for the Gap of Rohan and take the West road to my city!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: The Gap of Rohan takes us too close to Isengard.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: We cannot pass over a mountain. Let us go under it. Let us go through the Mines of Moria. ANGLE ON: GANDALF has a concerned look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Moria. You fear to go into those mines, don’t you? The Dwarves delved too greedily and too deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SARUMAN sits in ORTHANC reviewing an ancient te CLOSE ON: The BOOK showing the DOOR to MORIA. SARUMAN (CONT’D) You know what they awoke in the darkness of Khazad-daim. Shadow and flame. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Let the Ring-bearer decide. CLOSE ON: FRODO, the weight of the decision weighing heav upon him. CLOSE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN shivering in BOROMIR’S arms. GANDALF (CONT’D) Frodo? FRODO meets GANDALF’S eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: We will go through the mines. GANDALF slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: So be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The FELLOWSHIP makes their way in the shadow of ruins of a great aqueduct in the mist and ice of the moun ANGLE ON: GANDALF beckons to FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Frodo, come and help an old man. ANGLE ON: FRODO comes forward and allows GANDALF to lean

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: How is your shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Better than it was. GANDALF stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: And the Ring? You feel its power growing, don’t you? I’ve felt it too. You must be careful now. Evil will be drawn to you from outside the Fellowship. And, I fear, from within. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR passes them. They glance at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (subdued) Who then do I trust?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: You must trust yourself. Trust your own strengths.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: There are many powers in this world for good or for evil. Some are greater than I am. And against some I have not yet been tested. CLOSE ON: GIMLI comes to the top of the path and looks in WONDER.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (in awe) The Walls of Moria! WIDE ON: The FELLOWSHIP stands before a looming cliff cut sheer formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footing is treacherous on the narrow strips of green and stones. ANGLE ON: GIMLI taps the WALL with his axe, listening. GA does the same with his staff.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Dwarf doors are invisible when closed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Yes, Gimli, their own masters cannot find them if their secrets are forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t that surprise me? CLOSE ON: GIMLI sniffs with disgust at the comment. ANGLE ON: GANDALF approaches the smooth rock wall between TWISTED, GNARLED TREES ... Slowly, faint lines appear lik slender veins of luminous silver running through the ston

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Isildin ... it mirrors only starlight and moonlight. ANGLE ON: A LARGE MOON rises over the mountains. ANGLE ON: The lines on the wall grow BROADER and CLEARER, forming a glowing arch of interlacing ancient letters and symbols. GANDALF (CONT’D) It reads, “The door of Durin, Lord of Moria. Speak, friend, and enter.”

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What do you suppose that means?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (confident ) It’s simple. If you are a friend, you speak the password and the doors will open. GANDALF raises his arms... GANDALF (CONT’D) (incanting) Annon Edhellen, edro hi ammen! Gate of the Elves, open now for me! The cliff towers into the night, the wind blows cold, FRO shivers... and the door stands fast. Undaunted, GANDALF r his arms again... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Fennas Nogothrim, lasto beth lammen. Doorway of the Dwarf-folk, listen to the word of my tongue.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening. ANGLE ON: GANDALF glances at him, annoyed. He begins to p the doors, but they remain fast.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I once knew every spell in all the tongues of Elves, Men, and Orcs.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, then?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (angrily) Knock your head against these doors, Peregrin Took! And if that does not shatter them, and I am allowed a little peace from foolish questions, I will try to find the opening words.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF CONTINUES...
dialogues.text: MUMBLING spells in his efforts to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (wearily) Ando Eldarinwa ... a lasta quettanya, Fenda Casarinwa... Gate of Elves ... listen to my word, Threshold of Dwarves... ANGLE ON: SAM packs pots and pans at his feet ... watchin as ARAGORN unsaddles BILL THE PONY. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN whispering to BILL THE PONY. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mines are no place for a Pony, even one so brave as Bill.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Bye, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Go on, Bill, go on ... don't worry, Sam ... he knows his way home. ARAGORN slaps BILL on the rump ... BILL goes trotting off CLOSE ON: SAM watching BILL disappear into the darkness. SPLASH! MERRY and PIPPIN are tossing stones into the lake RIPPLING RINGS slowly fan out. PIPPIN is about to throw a stone, but ARAGORN grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (ominous) Do not disturb the water. ARAGORN watches anxiously as the RIPPLES appear to grow . exchanges a look with BOROMIR. ARAGORN’S hand creeps towards his sword. ANGLE ON: GANDALF gives up in despair ... he sits down be FRODO. CLOSE ON: FRODO peers at the ELVISH INSCRIPTION ... his f breaks into a smile of comprehension.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (quietly) It's a riddle... GANDALF raises his eyebrows...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Speak, friend, and enter. What's the Elvish word for friend?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Oh .... mellon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With that, the rock face silently divides in the middle a GREAT DOORS swing outwards ... revealing a blackness deep night. As the FELLOWSHIP enter the BLACKNESS something in water stirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FELLOWSHIP step warily into the darkness of MORIA ... CAVERN, with winding steps leading deeper into the mounta

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Soon, Master Elf, you will enjoy the fabled hospitality of the Dwarves; roaring fires, malt beer, red meat off the bone! This, my friend, is the home of my cousin Balin ... And they call this a mine. (snorting) A mine! ANGLE ON: A GLOW from GANDALF’S STAFF suddenly lights the chamber ... The FELLOWSHIP recoil in HORROR! Many DWARF SKELETONS are strewn about, clearly in the dead of some o battle ... the rusting armor and shields are peppered wit arrows and axes

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (grimly ) This is no mine ... It's a tomb!

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (in horror) Oh... no... no... no...! LEGOLAS pulls a crude arrow out of a SKELETON.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Goblins. The FELLOWSHIP draw swords and back away, towards the ENT

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: We make for the Gap of Rohan. We should never have come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO is suddenly PULLED TO THE GROUND! A LONG TENTACLE is wrapped around FRODO’S ankle and is dragging towards the lake! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRODO CRIES OUT as ARAGORN and BOROMIR rush forward! ARAG severs the TENTACLE holding FRODO, and pulls him to safet BOROMIR hacks at the other WRITHING LIMBS, 20 more tentac ripple out of the LAKE! The dark water BOILS as the hideo beast lashes out at the FELLOWSHIP! Again the creature grabs FRODO and pulls him to the lake. is flung in the air as the FELLOWSHIP battle the creature ARAGORN hacks at a tentacle ... FRODO is released, fallin BOROMIR’S arms.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Into the mines!

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Legolas! LEGOLAS shoots an ARROW into the creature’s head, gaining vital seconds for ARAGORN and BOROMIR as they race out of water with FRODO. The FELLOWSHIP hurriedly back away from CREATURE ... retreating into the MORIA CHAMBER as many CO ARMS seize the large doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a shattering echo, the creature rips the doors away, creating a rock slide that crashes down the CLIFF FACE. W seconds, tons of rock seal the doorway ... throwing the FELLOWSHIP into PITCH BLACKNESS. ANGLE ON: A faint light rises from GANDALF’S staff, throw CREEPY GLOW across the old wizard’s face.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (ominous) Now we have but one choice ... we must face the long dark of Moria. Be on your guard ... there are older and fouler things than the Orcs in the deep places of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: THE FELLOWSHIP crossing a precarious bridge abov mine workings. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Quietly, now. It’s a four day journey to the other side. Let us hope that our presence will go unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The FELLOWSHIP enter a CHAMBER with old ropes a ancient ladders. ANGLE ON: GANDALF touches a shining substance on the wall

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: The wealth of Moria was not in gold or jewels but mithril. GANDALF holds his staff over the expansive drop beside th FELLOWSHIP looks down. ANGLE ON: The ENDLESS DEPTH of the mine. A FAINT, BLUE GL issues from its depths. It looks all but abandoned. The FELLOWSHIP continues onward.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Bilbo had a shirt of mithril rings that Thorin gave him.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Oh, that was a kingly gift.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Yes. I never told him, but its worth was greater than the value of the Shire. CLOSE ON: FRODO’S eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue up a steep stair, passing through a DWARF CEMETERY. The graves are despoiled ... DWARF SKELETONS ar strewn about and GOBLIN GRAFFITI is scrawled on monuments DRIED DWARF BLOOD. THE ATMOSPHERE is very sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The path splits into three passages ... each disappearing dark tunnel. GANDALF pauses, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: I have no memory of this place. LATER... THE FELLOWSHIP are nervously waiting ... while GANDALF si staring intently at the 3 tunnel mouths in front of him. appears to be in some kind of trance. CLOSE ON: FRODO turns at the sound of a faint noise down tunnel behind them.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Are we lost?

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: No. I don’t think we are. Shhh, Gandalf’s thinking.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Merry!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. FRODO’S POV: a sudden glimpse of a creature darting in th darkness. FRODO is nervous...he approaches GANDALF.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (whispers) There's something down there.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (quietly) It's Gollum.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Gollum!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: He's been following us for three days. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEASING SHOT: An emaciated, leering creature.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) He escaped from the dungeons of Barad-dar?

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Escaped ... or was set loose. And now the Ring has drawn him here ... he will never be rid of his need for it. He hates and loves the Ring, as he hates and loves himself. Sméagol’s life is a sad story. GANDALF catches FRODO’S look of surprise. GANDALF (CONT’D) Yes ... Sméagol he was once called Before the Ring came to him, before it drove him mad. GOLLUM’S withered fingers are gripping the cave wall ... LARGE LUMINOUS eyes blinking with malice.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (grim) It’s a pity Bilbo didn't kill him when he had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Pity? It was pity that stayed Bilbo’s hand. Many that live deserve death, and some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them, Frodo? FRODO frowns. GANDALF (CONT’D) Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgment ... even the very wise cannot see all ends. My heart tells me that Gollum has some part to play yet, for good or ill before this is over. The pity of Bilbo may rule the fate of many.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I wish the Ring had never come to me I wish none of this had happened. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us. There is a note of finality in GANDALF’S voice. GANDALF (CONT’D) There are other forces at work in this world, Frodo, besides the will of evil. Bilbo was meant to find the Ring. In which case, you also were meant to have it ... and that is an encouraging thought. (sudden brightness) Ah! It's that way. GANDALF points at the right hand tunnel ... the FELLOWSHI scramble to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (relieved) He's remembered!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: No. But the air doesn’t smell so foul down here. If in doubt, Meriadoc, always follow your nose! (laughs) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FELLOWSHIP pass under an arched doorway into a black empty space. GANDALF pauses...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Let me risk a little more light. GANDALF taps his staff ... for a brief moment a light bla like a silent FLASH OF LIGHTNING. GREAT SHADOWS spring up flee...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Behold! The great realm and Dwarf-city of Dwarrowdelf. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO gasps at the brief sight of a roof, far a their heads, upheld by many mighty pillars of stone. Before them stretches a huge empty hall, with black walls polished and smooth as glass.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well, there's an eye opener and no mistake! Ahead of them, a wooden door has been smashed. BLACK ARRO embedded in the timbers. TWO GOBLIN SKELETONS lie in the doorway. GIMLI rushes ahead...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Gimli! !

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BALIN’S TOMB, MORIA - DAY GIMLI rushes into another vast empty chamber ... lit with narrow shaft of sunlight, beaming in from a small hole ne roof. DWARF AND GOBLIN SKELETONS are piled high. In the f corner sits a stone walled WELL. A SHAFT OF LIGHT falls d onto a stone table in the middle of the room: a single ob block, about 4 feet high, topped with a great slab of whi stone. GIMLI falls to his knees...

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: No...no...oh, no! GIMLI sobs. GANDALF quietly reads an inscription of runes, carved ont white stone slab.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: “Here lies Balin, son of Fundin, Lord of Moria.” He is dead, then. It’s as I feared.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (chanting softly, sobbing) Kilmin malur ni zaram kalil ra narag. Kheled-zaram ... Balin tazlifi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF carefully lifts the rotting remains of a book fro white stone slab. It has been slashed and stabbed ... and appears to be covered in DRIED BLOOD. The pages crack and as he opens it.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper to Aragorn) We must move on. We cannot linger.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (reading) “They have taken the Bridge and the second hall: we have barred the gates ... but cannot hold them for long ... the ground shakes ... drums drums in the deep ... we cannot get out. A shadow moves in the dark. Will no-one save us? They are coming.” ANGLE ON: Unnerved, PIPPIN backs away nervously ... He st against the well, sending a precariously balanced ARMORED SKELETON tumbling in! MERRY reaches out, GRABBING hold of PIPPIN before he fall FELLOWSHIP freeze in stunned silence as the armored skele clatters down the deep well ... echoing loudly! ANGLE ON: GANDALF turns angrily on PIPPIN.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (angrily) Fool of a Took! Throw yourself in next time, and rid us of your stupidity! ANGLE ON: PIPPIN, CHASTENED. They fall silent. A low rolling BOOM rises from the depth growing louder ... BOOM ... BOOM ... as if the caverns of MORIA were turned into a vast drum. A great horn blasts n . ANSWERING horns ... running feet ... harsh cries CLOSE ON: SAM’S eyes glance at FRODO’S belt...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (worried) Mr. Frodo! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO looks down. A cold blue glow is emanating STING’S SCABBARD! FRODO draws the SWORD ... and stares at glowing blade!

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Orcs!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (to the Hobbits) Get back! Stay close to Gandalf. ARAGORN and BOROMIR slam and wedge the doors. BOROMIR cat sight of something; he turns to ARAGORN with shock in his

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: They have a cave-troll! ANGLE ON: GIMLI snatches up two rusty Dwarf axes and leap the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (yelling) Let them come! There is one Dwarf yet in Moria who still draws breath! BOOM! The door bursts open in a shower of wood fragments, GOBLINS charge into the tomb, followed by a HUGH CAVE TRO ANGLES ON: GIMLI ducks a blow and immediately buries his 2 GOBLIN HELMETS. ARAGORN and BOROMIR wade into the mass GOBLINS with their swords. LEGOLAS fires deadly arrows in GOBLIN throats, desperately trying to SHIELD the HOBBITS! GANDALF is clutching his sword, GLAMDRING, and joins in t battle! ANGLES ON: The CAVE TROLL is sweeping his club at ARAGORN who stumbles backwards ... the huge club descends for the killing blow ... SUDDENLY, in a FLASH OF STEEL, BOROMIR’S sword SLICES into the SCALY ARM of the TROLL; it rears ba

dialogues.speaker: SPEWING GREEN BLOOD
dialogues.text: ANGLES ON: SAM is backed up against a wall .. a sword in hand, a SAUCEPAN in the other. In desperation he swings w at a GOBLIN with the saucepan! It keels over ... SAM look surprised. He wallops another GOBLIN and it too, drops.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think I’m getting the hang of this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The CAVE TROLL lunges forward, thrusting at FRO chest with his spear.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Aragorn! Aragorn! SAM screams as FRODO is lifted off his feet by the spear slammed against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (shocked yell) Frodo! ANGLES ON: The HOBBITS go crazy. SAM slashes at the CAVE knee, bringing him down ... MERRY and PIPPIN jump on him LEGOLAS fires an arrow ... and the CAVE TROLL topples, de ANGLE ON: ARAGORN rushes to FRODO’S side as he slumps to floor ... FRODO appears to be dead. CLOSE ON: GANDALF, ARAGORN, HOBBITS looking horrified... SUDDENLY, FRODO coughs ... takes a huge breath.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I'm all right. I'm not hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: You should be dead. That spear would have skewered a wild boar.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
