dialogues.text: I think there’s more to this Hobbit than meets the eye. ANGLE ON: FRODO opens his shirt to reveal the MITHRIL VES TROLL SPEAR did not pierce the MITHRIL.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Mithril! You are full of surprises, Master Baggins. BOOM. BOOM. BOOM. the sound of the drums rings out again! GANDALF turns to the other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: To the bridge of Khazad-Ddm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANDALF leads the FELLOWSHIP into the huge DWARROWDELF CH

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: This way! They hurry towards a distant door ... as GOBLINS start sc down the PILLARS behind them, like cockroaches! ANGLE ON: FRODO looks with horror at the overwhelming GOB army that’s rushing towards them! SUDDENLY! A deafening roar fills the air! A fiery light d down the hallway ... the pillars castings eerie shadows. ANGLES ON: The GOBLINS freeze. They back fearfully away f approaching beast ... melting into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: What is this new devilry? A HUGE SHADOW, surrounded by FLAME, falls across the hall the ground shakes ... an unearthly sound rumbles.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (quietly) A Balrog ... a demon of the ancient world! This foe is beyond any of you! (urgent yell) Run! Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BALROG, a massive creature rises from a chasm, a grea FOOT MAN-BEAST, with a MANE OF FLAMES! In one hand is a B like a stabbing TONGUE OF FIRE; in the other, a WHIP of M THONGS. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN leads the FELLOWSHIP to the top of a di stairway ... GANDALF follows, leaning heavily on his staf (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: ARAGORN looks at GANDALF, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: Lead them on, Aragorn! The bridge is near. ARAGORN hesitates ... GANDALF looks at him. GANDALF (CONT’D) Do as I say; Swords are no more use here. The FELLOWSHIP race down the stairway. ARAGORN picks up FRODO ... leaping across a gaping chasm GANDALF yells to the others. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN makes to throw GIMLI across the chasm.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Nobody tosses a dwarf! The BALROG smashes through the wall and spreads its VAST It swoops down past the FELLOWSHIP, disappearing into a F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FELLOWSHIP run into the SECOND HALL ... the floor is with fissures that spit flame.

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (yelling) Over the bridge! Fly! They race towards the slender bridge of stone ... without or rail ... at the far end of the hall. The FELLOWSHIP recklessly hurry over the dizzying bridge .. but GANDALF last ... pauses in the middle of the span ... he faces th BALROG ... staff in one hand ... GLAMDRING in the other! ANGLE ON: FRODO looks back in horror: GANDALF (CONT’D) You cannot pass! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (alarmed yell) Gandalf!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (yelling) I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Uddin. FRODO watches as the BALROG puts one foot on the bridge a draws up to FULL HEIGHT, wings spreading from wall-to-wal GANDALF is a tiny figure, balanced precariously on the na bridge. GANDALF (CONT’D) Go back to the Shadow! The BALROG slashes at GANDALF with its SWORD OF FLAME ... GANDALF blocks with GLAMDRING ... a ringing clash and the BALROG’S SWORD SHATTERS into MOLTEN FRAGMENTS!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (booming) You shall not pass!! The BALROG places one foot onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: He cannot stand alone! Elendil! I am with you Gandalf!

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (raising his sword) Gondor! ANGLE ON: ARAGORN and BOROMIR race forward, swords drawn. GANDALF CRIES ALOUD as he summons his LAST RESERVES OF

dialogues.speaker: STRENGTH
dialogues.text: He thumps the bridge with his staff ... a blinding sheet white flame springs up ... the staff shatters ... the bri breaks ... right at the BALROG’S feet. The stone bridge drops away into the GULF ... from under BALROG. For a moment, the great BEAST remains poised in t then it plunges down: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: RELIEF floods FRODO’S face ... GANDALF remai trembling on the lip of the broken bridge. SLOW MOTION: As the BALROG falls, he lashes out with his fire... SLOW MOTION: The thongs of the whip lash and curl around GANDALF’S knees, dragging him over the brink! GANDALF jus manages to hang on by his fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (screaming) Gandalf!

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF
dialogues.text: (fierce) Fly, you fools! CLOSE ON: GANDALF lets go his grip and falls away ... fol the BALROG into the BOTTOMLESS ABYSS! FRODO cries out! BOROMIR scoops him up and carries him aw

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Gandalf! They rush towards an archway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FELLOWSHIP tumble out of the GREAT EASTERN GATE on to grassy sunlit hillside. SAM, MERRY, and PIPPIN fall slowl the ground, SOBBING ANGLE ON: ARAGORN turns to LEGOLAS and GIMLI.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (urgent) Legolas, get them up.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Give them a moment ... for pity's sake! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: By nightfall these hills will be swarming with Orcs! We must reach the woods of Lothloérien. Come Boromir, Legolas, Gimli, get them up. On your feet, Sam. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR glances towards FRODO, then back at ARA ANGLE ON: FRODO is walking away, as if in a daze. ARAGORN (CONT’D) Frodo? Frodo! CLOSE ON: FRODO SLOWLY TURNS ... a look of numb shock on devastated face. The FELLOWSHIP marches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARAGORN scours ahead of the COMPANY, as they stumble on i fading light ... in the distance the shimmer of a large f can be seen ... LOTHLORIEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The FELLOWSHIP run across a forest floor strewn YELLOW FLOWERS ... above is a ROOF OF GOLDEN LEAVES, held SILVER PILLARS ... the TRUNKS of HUGE, GREY TREES. ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS, taking in the surroundings as if a ret home.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (musing) Ah, Lothlérien. The fairest of all the dwellings of my people. There are no trees like the trees of this land, for in autumn the leaves fall not, but turn to gold. Not till the spring comes and the new green opens do they fall, and then the boughs are laden with yellow flowers; and the floor of the wood is golden, and golden is the roof, and its pillars are of silver, for the bark of the trees is smooth and grey. So still our songs in Mirkwood say. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: In contrast, GIMLI looks nervously around...

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Stay close, young Hobbits ... they say a great sorceress lives in these woods. An Elf-witch of terrible power. All who look upon her fall under her spell... CLOSE ON: FRODO hesitates ... a STRANGE VOICE whispers in head...

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Frodo...

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: And are never seen again!

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...your coming to us is as the footsteps of doom. You bring great evil here, Ring-bearer.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo?

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Well, here’s one Dwarf she won't ensnare so easily. I have the eyes of a hawk and the ears of a fox! The FELLOWSHIP are suddenly surrounded by ARMED ELVES. DE ARROWS are aimed at their heads. HALDIR, the ELVISH CAPTA steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: The Dwarf breathes so loud we could have shot him in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is deepening amongst the windy trees. The FELLOWSHI stands on a platform in the trees. HALDIR greets them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: (Elvish; with subtitles) Mae govannen, Legolas Thranduilion. Welcome Legolas, son of Thranduil.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (Elvish; with subtitles) Govannas vin gwennen le, Haldir o Loérien. Our Fellowship stands in your debt, Haldir of Lorien. HALDIR glances at ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: (Elvish; with subtitles) A, Aragorn in Dunedain istannen le ammen. Oh, Aragorn of the Dunedain, you are known to us.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Haldir.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: So much for the legendary courtesy of the Elves! Speak words we can also understand!

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: We have not had dealings with the Dwarves since the Dark Days.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: And you know what this Dwarf says to that? Ishkhaqwi ai durugnul! I spit on your grave! ARAGORN takes GIMLI by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (stern) That was not so courteous. HALDIR moves on to FRODO. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: You bring great evil with you. (to ARAGORN) You can go no further. HALDIR walks away. ANGLE ON: SAM and PIPPIN turn to look at FRODO. FRODO app uncomfortable. LATER... The FELLOWSHIP sit while ARAGORN speaks with HALDIR.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Boe ammen veriad lin. Andelu i ven! We need your protection. The road is fell! HALDIR whispers back inaudibly.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Merin le telim. I wish we may come with you. HALDIR answers quietly, again so that only ARAGORN can he words.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Henio, aniron boe ammen i dulu lin! Please, understand, we need your support! ANGLE ON: FRODO looks to the remainder of the FELLOWSHIP. they meet his eyes, they look away, as if he has become a scourge to them. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN continues to argue loudly with HALDIR. ANGLE ON: FRODO, looking at his friends, sees blame that not truly exist anywhere but in his mind. He is alone, it ANGLE ON: ARAGORN pleads with HALDIR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Andelu i ven. The road is very dangerous. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR approaches FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Gandalf's death was not in vain. nor would he have you give up hope. You carry a heavy burden, Frodo. Don't carry the weight of the dead. HALDIR stands before FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: Very well. Here we will stay awhile, and come to the city of Galadhrim on the morrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SAM and FRODO sit on one of the many platforms trees at CERIN AMROTH. SAM suddenly looks up and around, puzzled expression. He rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s an odd thing, Mr. Frodo. It’s sunlight and bright day, right enough. I thought that Elves were all for moon and stars. But this is more Elvish than anything I ever heard tell of. I feel as if I was inside a song, if you take my meaning.

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: (from behind them) You feel the power of the Lady of Galadhrim. Would it please you to climb with me up Cerin Amroth? WIDE ON: FRODO and SAM follow HALDIR up a long series of platforms until they reach the pinnacle of the trees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO and SAM approach the edge of a high platf look out in wonder. HIGH WIDE SHOT: MIDDLE EARTH stretches out for miles and to the NORTH. Far to the NORTH, a shadow lingers over the OF MIRKWOOD. ANGLE ON: HALDIR points the HOBBITS’ gaze to the dark clo

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: There lies the fastness of Southern Mirkwood. It is clad in a forest of dark fir, where the trees strive one against another and their branches rot and whither. In the midst upon a stony height stands Dol Guldur, where long the hidden Enemy had his dwelling. We fear that now it is inhabited again, and with power sevenfold. A black cloud lies often over it of late. PAN ON WIDE SHOT: From ORTHANC to the WEST across the magnificent view to MORDOR and BARAD-DOR in the EAST. HALDIR (CONT’D) In this high place you may see the two powers that are oppose one to another; and ever they strive now in thought, but whereas the light perceives the very heart of the darkness, its own secret has not been discovered. Not yet. ANGLE ON: HALDIR leaves the high place. With a final look and SAM follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A SMALL GOLDEN FLOWER in someone’s hand. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN, admiring the beauty of this flower.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Arwen vanimelda, namarié. ANGLE ON: FRODO approaches. ARAGORN sighs, and then turns FRODO and smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Here is the heart of Elvendom on earth, and here my heart dwells ever, unless there be a light beyond the dark roads that we still must tread, you and I.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Do you believe we may yet succeed in our quest?

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: We shall endure to the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALDIR leads the FELLOWSHIP onto a HILL TOP. They look wi wonderment at the vista spread before them. WIDE ON: Several miles towards the SOUTH, a LARGE HILL ri of the woods. Upon the hill rise many mighty MALLORN TREE taller than any others ... NESTLED high in the crown of t mallorns is a BEAUTIFUL CITY. It GLEAMS in the low rays o late afternoon ... green, gold, and silver. To the east o GALADHON, the WOODS of LORIEN run down the pale gleam of the great river. Beyond the RIVER, the land appears flat and empty, formle vague, until far away, it rises again like a dark dreary The SUN that lies on LOTHLORIEN has not power to enlighte shadows that lie beyond.

dialogues.speaker: HALDIR
dialogues.text: Caras Galadon. The heart of Elvendom on earth. This is the city of Galadhrim where dwell the Lord Celeborn and of Galadriel, Lady of Light.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CELEBORN’S CHAMBER, CARAS GALADHON - NIGHT ANGLE ON: THE FELLOWSHIP step onto a wide fleet filled wi soft light. The walls are green and silver, the roof gold its midst is the trunk of the mighty MALLORN TREE, now ta toward its crown. (CONTINUED)

CELEBORN steps forward to greet the guests. His hair is long and silver, his face grave and beautiful, with no of age upon it. Next to him stands GALADRIEL, the LADY OF ELVES. She has hair of deep gold and timeless unsurpassed beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: memory of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CELEBORN looks hard at ARAGORN...

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN
dialogues.text: The enemy knows you have entered here. What hope you had in secrecy is now gone. Eight there are here, yet nine there were set out from Rivendell. Tell me, where is Gandalf? For I much desire to speak with him. I can no longer see him from afar. FRODO looks at GALADRIEL, standing silently beside

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: (softly aloud) Gandalf the Grey did not pass the borders of this land. He has fallen into Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: He was taken by both Shadow and flame. A Balrog of Morgoth. For we went needlessly into the net of Moria. The FELLOWSHIP bow their heads in sadness at the GANDALF. CELEBORN appears surprised.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Needless were none of the deeds of Gandalf in life. We do not yet know his full purpose. surveys the face of the FELLOWSHIP. GIMLI looks up as GALADRIEL addresses him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gaze with

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Do not let the great emptiness of Khazad-dam fill your heart Gimli, son of Gléin. For the world has grown full of peril, and in all lands, love is now mingled with grief. GALADRIEL looks over he FELLOWSHIP again to meet her BOROMIR’S. BOROMIR is suddenly fearful and nervous. GALADRIEL’S eyes piercing BOROMIR. BOROMIR turns away from her. GALADRIEL’S gaze remains on him for a moment before turning to CELEBORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL’ GALADRIEL’

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN
dialogues.text: What now becomes of this Fellowship? Without Gandalf, hope is lost. GALADRIEL looks to ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: The quest stands upon the edge of a knife. Stray but a little and it will fail, to the ruin of all... Yet hope remains while the company is true. S eyes settle on SAM.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Do not let your hearts be troubled. Go now and rest, for you are weary with sorrow and much toil. S eyes turn to FRODO ... her voice fades.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Tonight you will sleep in peace. (whispered v/o) Welcome, Frodo of the Shire... FRODO looks at GALADRIEL. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUDDEN INSERT: GALADRIEL as she is on the other side ... POWERFUL, DIVINE ... no longer of this world ... a PIERCI white light surrounds her. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) ...one who has seen the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIMLI, LEGOLAS, MERRY, PIPPIN, FRODO, and SAM are in a pa set among the trees near the fountain. They lie on soft c as ELVES leave food and wine for them. MOURNFUL SINGING d down from the trees above.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: (sadly) A lament for Gandalf...

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: What do they say about him?

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: I have not the heart to tell you. For me, the grief is still too near. ANGLE ON: FRODO lies on his bed watching the others. SAM with PIPPIN.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I bet they don’t mention his fireworks. There should be a verse about them. ANGLE ON: SAM stands up to add his own verse to the ELVEN

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The finest rockets ever seen They burst in stars of blue and green Or after thunder, silver showers Come falling like a rain of flowers. Oh, that doesn’t do them justice by a long road. SAM sits down, frustrated and disappointed with himself. (CONTINUED)
BOROMIR is sitting alone ... ARAGORN approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Take some rest. These borders are well protected. Moonlight catches the trace of tears on BOROMIR’S face. ARAGORN kneels beside him.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: I will find no rest here. I heard her voice inside my head. She spoke of my father and the fall of Gondor. She said to me, “Even now, there is hope left.” But I cannot see it ... it is long since we had any hope. BOROMIR looks at ARAGORN in despair. BOROMIR (CONT’D) My father is a noble man, but his rule is failing, and our ... our people lose faith. He looks to me to make things right ... and I would do it, I would see the glory of Gondor restored. Have you ever seen it, Aragorn? The White Tower of Ecthelion, glimmering like a spike of pearl and silver, its banners caught high in the morning breeze have you ever been called home by the clear ringing of silver trumpets?

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: I have seen the White City ... long ago. BOROMIR feels ARAGORN’S love for MINAS TIRITH and takes h

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: One day, our paths will lead us there, and the tower guard will take up the call “the Lords of Gondor have returned.” ARAGORN returns BOROMIR’S smile ... betraying his disquie sadness only when BOROMIR looks away.  144. LATER... The FELLOWSHIP are asleep on their beds. GIMLI is snoring loudly. CLOSE ON: BARE FEET treads soundlessly across the lawn. CLOSE ON: FRODO’S EYES FLICKER OPEN ... as if by instinct ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL, her WHITE dress glowing in the moonl glances at him. FRODO follows her ... as if drawn by an invisible force. EXT. GALADRIEL’S GLADE, LOTHLORIEN - NIGHT Upon a low stone pedestal, carved like a branching tree, shallow SILVER BASIN. GALADRIEL leads FRODO into the smal GLADE.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Will you look into the mirror? ANGLE ON: FRODO looks with apprehension at the silver bas

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (warily) What will I see? GALADRIEL pours water into the basin from a silver jug .. GLOW rises from the water.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Even the wisest cannot tell. For the mirror shows many things ... things that were ... things that are ... and some things that have not yet come to pass. FRODO slowly steps up to the PEDESTAL ... he peers into t glossy surface. The night sky is reflected in the water . suddenly a figure takes form ... the bowed figure of an O CLAD IN WHITE ROBES. He walks down a long road. FRODO lea closer to the mirror’s surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO gasps, his face lighting up with hope.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (joyous) Gandalf! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF looks at FRODO with a fierce intensity. FRODO rea out his hand toward the surface of the mirror. Suddenly t image flares, burning out to white. THE VISION SHIFTS ... FRODO gasps in horror! The SHIRE is ruins! THE IMAGE SUDDENLY WIDENS TO FILL THE SCREEN ... building burning ... bodies strewn about ... DARK SHAPES of ORCS l and destroying ... BAG END, billowing in flames! The Part is hacked down. ANGLE ON: FRODO reels back as the mirror seems to grow. T nightmarish image sweeps past his head, engulfing him ent IMAGE: HOBBITON ... now an INDUSTRIAL WASTELAND. The fiel trees destroyed ... replaced with BRICK FACTORIES belchin smoke! IMAGE: ORCS brutally herd manacled HOBBITS into the FACTO We see SAM ... MERRY ... and ROSIE COTTON. SOOT-STAINED a SOBBING, they disappear into the factory hellhole! SUDDENLY, the mirror goes dark ... and out of the black a SINGLE EYE GROWS. CLOSE ON: FRODO IS FROZEN. Unable to move or cry out. The dangles from his neck, inches above the water ... not shi with curls of steam. FIRE erupts around the EYE. WITH A YELL, FRODO pushes himself away from the pedestal collapses on the ground. Light instantly fades from the m FRODO comes to his senses ... he is shocked. ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL stands still as a statue, unmoved, un by the horror.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: I know what it is you saw ... for it is also in my mind. It is the future, Frodo. It is what will come to pass if you should fail. GALADRIEL looks at FRODO intensely ... FRODO looks down . his hand he is clutching the RING. FRODO looks up at GALA (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (CONT’D) The Fellowship is breaking. It is already begun. He will try to take the Ring. You know of whom I speak. One by one, it will destroy them all.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If you ask it of me, I will give you the One Ring.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: You offer it to me freely ... I do not deny that my heart has greatly desired this. suddenly seems to rise in stature before FRODO’S eyes. FRODO is suddenly afraid of her.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: In place of the Dark Lord, you would have a Queen, not dark, but beautiful and terrible as the Dawn. Treacherous as the Sea! Stronger than the foundations of the earth ... All shall love me and despair! FRODO takes a step away from GALADRIEL... GALADRIEL suddenly laughs ... a slender ELF-WOMAN once more, clad in simple white, her voice soft and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (CONT’D) (gently) I pass the test. (laughs) I will diminish, and go into the west, and remain Galadriel. FRODO’S confidence drains away.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I cannot do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: You are a Ring-bearer, Frodo. To bear a Ring of Power is to be alone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: GALADRIEL raises her hand to show FRODO her own GALADRIEL (CONT’D) This is Nenya, the Ring of Adamant. And I am its keeper. GALADRIEL lowers her hand, hiding NENYA once more. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) This task was appointed to you. And if you do not find a way, no one will. ANGLE ON: FRODO realizes what her message is.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Then I know what I must do. It's just I’m afraid to do it. GALADRIEL kneels down to FRODO’S height, staring at him intently.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future. CLOSE ON: THE RING lies in the palm of FRODO’S hand ... h fingers close over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKED, LURTZ’S eyes follow SARUMAN, alight with a mean intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Do you know how Orcs first came into being? They were Elves once. Taken by the Dark Powers ... tortured and mutilated ... a ruined and terrible form of life. And now perfected. My fighting Uruk-Hai. Whom do you serve?

dialogues.speaker: LURTZ
dialogues.text: (guttural rasp) Saruman.  148.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS: LURTZ is quickly armored ... BREASTPLATE ... GUARDS, HELMET ... a sword is thrust in LURTZ’S hand. The HAI are smearing themselves in white paint ... a creepy ritualistic ceremony ... the WHITE HAND OF ISENGARD is sm on bodies, faces, and armor. ANGLE ON: SARUMAN addresses a crowd of 200 fully-armed UR

dialogues.speaker: SARUMAN
dialogues.text: Hunt them down. Do not stop until they are found. You do not know pain. You do not know fear. You will taste man-flesh. SARUMAN turns to LURTZ. SARUMAN (CONT’D) (coldly) One of the Halflings carries something of great value ... bring them to me alive and unspoiled ... kill the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LURTZ is leading 200 URUK-HAI out of ISENGARD ... they ru their powerful legs carrying them at speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mists of morning lay heavily along the river. Bare-br trees arch through the fogs, stray beams of light falling cold, blue waters. ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL approaches the bank in an elegant shi carved in the likeness of a swan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: An green, silver-veined ELVEN LEAF-BROOCH is cl ANGLE ON: ELVES clasp ELVEN CLOAKS around on the FELLOWSH each with a leaf-brooch.

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Never before have we clad strangers in the garb of our own people. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: CELEBORN addresses the FELLOWSHIP. CELEBORN (CONT’D) May these cloaks help shield you from unfriendly eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS grabs a couple of packs and puts them i Elven boat. MERRY and PIPPIN look up as he pulls a small of bread from one of the packs.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: Lembas. Elvish waybread. He takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: One small bite is enough to fill the stomach of a grown Man. He stuffs the remaining piece back in the pack and places the boats. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN nod as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: How many did you eat?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Four. MERRY nods and picks at his teeth. PIPPIN belches. ANGLES ON: The FELLOWSHIP continue to load the boats for journey ... LEGOLAS helps GIMLI into a boat ... SAM crawl another boat and quickly reveals he has no measure of sea

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every league you travel south, the danger will increase. Mordor Orcs now hold the eastern shore of the Anduin. Nor will you find safety on the western bank.  150.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: CELEBORN and ARAGORN walks toward the RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN
dialogues.text: Strange creatures bearing the white Hand have been seen on our borders. Seldom do Orcs journey in the open under the sun, yet these have done so. CLOSE ON: CELEBORN holds a DAGGER out the ARAGORN. ARAGOR takes the dagger and unsheathes it. It is a beautiful, ye deadly work of art.

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN
dialogues.text: (Elvish; subtitled) Le aphadar aen. You are being tracked. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN replaces the dagger in its sheath.

dialogues.speaker: CELEBORN
dialogues.text: By river you have the chance of outrunning the enemy to the Falls of Rauros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FELLOWSHIP are in three small ELVEN BOATS. ELVES quie watch them depart. CLOSE ON: LEGOLAS, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: My gift for you, Legolas, is a bow of the Galadhrim. Worthy of the skill of our woodland kin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS lifts an elegant BOW and tests its stre ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL smiles and walks to MERRY and PIPPIN. ANGLE ON: MERRY removes a dagger from its sheathe and gaz it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) These are the daggers of the Noldorin. They have already seen service in war. ANGLE ON: PIPPIN looks upon his gift with the fear he may to use it. He casts his eyes upon GALADRIEL. GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) Do not fear, young Peregrin Took. You will find your courage.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN ride expressionless in their b CLOSE ON: SAM, remembering... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) And for you, Samwise Gamgee, Elven rope made of hithlain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SAM bows to her, accepting his gift.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thank you, my lady. He looks at MERRY and PIPPIN, and then back to GALADRIEL.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Have you run out of those nice, shiny daggers? GALADRIEL smiles, and SAM holds onto his rope, embarrasse moves on to GIMLI, who stares at the ground in her presen

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: And what gift would a Dwarf ask of the Elves? ANGLE ON: GIMLI shakes his head quickly.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Nothing. He looks up at her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIMLI (CONT’D) Except to look upon the lady of the Galadhrim one last time for she is more fair than all the jewels beneath the earth. ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL laughs. GIMLI scowls at his foolishne turns away. He recovers and turns back to her. GIMLI (CONT’D) Actually... There was one thing. No, no, I couldn’t. It’s quite impossible. Stupid to ask.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: GIMLI rides silently before LEGOLAS. He closes eyes, allowing the memory to flood into his head. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL stands before ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: I have nothing greater to give than the gift you already bear. CLOSE ON: She touches the EVENSTAR PENDANT ARAGORN wears. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) (in Elvish; subtitled) Am meleth din. I ant e-guil Arwen Undémiel ... pelitha. For her love, I fear the grace of Arwen Evenstar ... will diminish.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (in Elvish; subtitled) Aniron i e broniatha ar periatham amar hen. Aniron e ciratha a Valannor. I would have her leave these shores, and be with her people. I would have her take the ship to Valinor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL
dialogues.text: That choice is yet before her. You have your own choice to make, Aragorn. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN straightens before her. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) To rise above the height of all your fathers since the days of Elendil or to fall into darkness with all that is left of your kin. Silence follows ... branches shake ... a spider web’s glimmering strands sway in the wind. ANGLE ON: GALADRIEL glances at the pendant, and smiles. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) (in Elvish; subtitled) Namarié. Farewell. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN bows to her and turns to leave. GALADRI stops him. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) (in Elvish; subtitled) Nadath na i moe cerich. Dan u-'eveditham, Elessar. There is much you have yet to do. We shall not meet again, Elessar.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: FRODO rides at the head of his boat.

dialogues.speaker: GALADRIEL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Farewell, Frodo Baggins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL gives FRODO a small CRYSTAL PHIAL. GALADRIEL (CONT’D) I give you the light of Earendil, our most beloved star. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GALADRIEL leans over and kisses his head.

dialogues.speaker: END FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: As the FELLOWSHIP’S boats drift past, GALADRIEL stands al watching from the banks of the river. In his head, FRODO hears her voice... GALADRIEL (V.0.) (CONT’D) May it be a light for you in dark places, when all other lights go out. CLOSE ON: GIMLI riding at the head of his boat, paddled b LEGOLAS.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: I have taken my worst wound at this parting having looked my last upon that which is fairest. Henceforth I will call nothing fair unless it be her gift to me.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: What was her gift?

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: I asked her for one hair from her golden head. She gave me three. CLOSE ON: LEGOLAS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats pass into the GREAT RIVER ANDUIN. The THREE ELV boats carry the FELLOWSHIP steadily southward. GREEN TREE slowly give way to a brown and withered land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The URUK forces are running through the trees with deadly purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flock of birds circle high above, BLACK against the PAL ARAGORN watches them with concern.  155.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE BOATS are safely stored on the bank out of the ANGLE ON: BOROMIR hides behind a rock watching the river. CLOSE ON: A LOG floats down the river. A HAND grasps the pulls itself onto it. Who or whatever it is seems to be t to remain concealed from the eyes of the FELLOWSHIP. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN approaches from behind BOROMIR.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Gollum. He has tracked us since Moria. GOLLUM’S POV: GOLLUM watches the BOROMIR and ARAGORN stan behind the ROCK. ANGLE ON: The log runs into a rock on the opposite side o river and stops.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I had hoped we would lose him on the river. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN and BOROMIR continue watching GOLLUM. ARAGORN (CONT’D) But he’s too clever a waterman.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: And if he alerts the enemy to our whereabouts, it will make the crossing even more dangerous. ANGLE ON: FRODO listens to the exchange between ARAGORN a BOROMIR. He looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Have some food, Mr. Frodo.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: No, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You haven’t eaten anything all day. You’re not sleeping, neither. Don’t think I haven’t noticed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SAM moves from the campfire to sit with FRODO.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo-

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I’m all right.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But you’re not. I’m here to help you. I promised Gandalf that I would. CLOSE ON: FRODO looks at SAM, sadly, with the full weight knowledge of what he must do.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You can’t help me, Sam. Not this time. Get some sleep. FRODO turns away from SAM and returns to his own thoughts Reluctantly, SAM concedes and leaves FRODO alone. ANGLE ON: BOROMIR turns away from the rock to ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Minas Tirith is the safer road. You know that. From there we can regroup. Strike out for Mordor from a place of strength.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: There is no strength in Gondor that can avail us.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: You were quick enough to trust the Elves. ARAGORN doesn’t respond, but listens impatiently. BOROMIR (CONT’D) (desperately) Have you so little faith in your own people? Yes, there is weakness. There is frailty. But there is courage also, and honor to be found in Men. But you will not see that. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN turns away from BOROMIR. BOROMIR grabs ARAGORN’S tunic, and turns ARAGORN to him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOROMIR (CONT’D) You are afraid! ANGLE ON: FRODO listens intently to BOROMIR arguing with ARAGORN. BOROMIR (0.S.) (CONT’D) All your life, you have hidden in the shadows. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN calmly listens to BOROMIR’S ravings. BOROMIR (CONT’D) Scared of who you are, of what you are. ARAGORN adjusts his tunic and turns away from BOROMIR. BO is speechless. ARAGORN turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: I will not lead the Ring within a hundred leagues of your city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BOROMIR, still feeling the defeat from the prev evening, paddles down the river along with the rest of th FELLOWSHIP. He glances scathingly towards ARAGORN. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN refuses to return his glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE ELVEN boats drift slowly through the steep rock in the PRE-DAWN light. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN, slowly paddling in the stern.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Frodo. FRODO slowly looks up, his eyes widening with amazement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: TWO ENORMOUS ROCK STATUES, towering like 300 foo pinnacles on either side of the river ... carved images o GONDORIAN KINGS of old. They loom over the boats with pow majesty. ARAGORN (CONT’D) The Argonath... CLOSE ON: ARAGORN ... strangely moved by the beauty of th Silent sentinels. He speaks, almost as if to himself. ARAGORN (CONT’D) Long have I desired to look upon the kings of old ... my kin. The FELLOWSHIP stare in stunned silence as the current ta them through the narrow gap at the STATUES’ feet. WIDE ON: CRANING UP past the statues vast crumbling heads REVEAL a LARGE LAKE only a mile down river...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: THE FELLOWSHIP as they leap out of the boats an clamber onto the wooded shore.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: We cross the lake at nightfall, hide the boats and continue on foot ... we approach Mordor from the North.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (gloomy ) Oh, yes, just a simple matter of finding our way through Emyn Muil, an impassable labyrinth of razor-sharp rocks. And after that, it gets even better ... a festering, stinking marshland as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: That is our road. I suggest you take some rest and recover your strength, Master Dwarf.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: (indignant ) Recover my... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS turns to ARAGORN with urgency.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: We should leave now.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: No. Orcs patrol the eastern shore. We must wait for cover of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: It is not the Eastern shore that worries me. LEGOLAS casts a glance around into the PARTH GALEN forest

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: A shadow and a threat has been growing in my mind. Something draws near, I can feel it. ARAGORN looks at LEGOLAS, knowing full well what he means ANGLE ON: SAM has slumped asleep. MERRY dumps a small pil kindling at GIMLI’S feet....

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Where’s Frodo? SAM sits up with a start ... ARAGORN’S head snaps around. eyes fly to BOROMIR’S shield which lies abandoned by his bed. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN ... as he realizes BOROMIR has gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO is walking beneath the trees ... lost in thought. H hit the rough edge of an ancient stone slab ... his eyes an overgrown path towards stone stairs leading to the SUM AMON HEN ... the seeing seat. A CRACKLING SOUND! FRODO freezes...

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (quietly) None of us should wander alone; you least of all. So much depends on you Frodo? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cautious. 160. FRODO turns slowly ... he stares at BOROMIR, tense,

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: I know why you seek solitude. You suffer, I see it day by day. Are you sure you do not suffer needlessly? FRODO stands silent for a moment ... the murmur of the WI the trees heard. and the distant roar of the FALLS OF RAUROS can be

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Let me help you. There are other ways, Frodo ... other paths that we might take.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I know what you would say, and it would sound like wisdom but for the warning of my heart.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Warning? Against what? BOROMIR has started forward towards FRODO. FRODO backs aw him. FRODO step BOROMIR (CONT’D) We’re all afraid, Frodo. But to let that fear drive us to destroy what hope we have ... don't you see that is madness?

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: There is no other way.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: I ask only for the strength to defend my people. (angrily drops the wood he has collected) If you would but lend me the Ring...

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: No... s hurriedly away from BOROMIR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Why do you recoil? I am no thief.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (wary) You are not yourself.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: What chance do you think you have? They will find you, they will take the Ring and you will beg for death before the end. FRODO turns to leave. BOROMIR (CONT’D) You fool! It is not yours, save by unhappy chance. It might have been mine! It should be mine! Give it to me! Give me the Ring. BOROMIR leaps on top of FRODO, grasping for the RING! FRO only moments to act. FRODO rips the RING from around his and rams it on his finger. FRODO DISAPPEARS. BOROMIR spins wildly around, yelling into thin air!

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: I see your mind ... you will take the Ring to Sauron. You will betray us! You go to your death and the death of us all! Curse you! Curse you and all your Halflings! BOROMIR stumbles and falls. His body shakes as if in the of a fit ... slowly, he comes to. BOROMIR (CONT’D) (disoriented) Frodo! Frodo! What have I done? Please, Frodo...  162.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE TWILIGHT WORLD: FRODO races through the misty Twil world, past the foggy shapes of twisted trees. Somewhere him, Boromir’s distraught voice carries, as if from anoth dimension.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Frodo ... Frodo... FRODO suddenly finds himself on the stone steps ... he cl up the stairs, onto a high seat, perched on four stone pi FRODO cowers on the seat, like a lost child upon the thro mountain kings. The world of mist swirls around him. FRODO peers out from the seat ... the world seems to shri all directions, VIEWS of far off lands TELESCOPE towards through the mist. IMAGES: ORCS spilling out of holes in the MISTY MOUNTAINS FLAMES rise from MIRKWOOD ... Grim faced EASTERLINGS marc war ... BLACK SHIPS sail to the South. All the power of t Lord is in motion. FRODO moves his gaze to the East ... FIRE explodes agains smoke, as a huge mass of black battlements fills Frodo’s A mountain of iron, immeasurably strong, tower of adamant BARAD-DOR, the fortress of SAURON. SUDDENLY! SAURON’S EYE LEAPS TOWARD FRODO LIKE A FINGER O LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: SAURON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (IN BLACK SPEECH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will fall! ANGLE ON: FRODO leaps off the seat, and tumbles down the The EYE sweeps AMON HEN like a searchlight, seeking its R With a huge effort, FRODO wrenches the RING off his finge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO lies gasping on the SUMMIT OF AMON HEN ... below th ancient ruins of the seeing seat.

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: FRODO looks up as ARAGORN towers over him.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Frodo? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (numb) It has taken Boromir. ARAGORN moves towards FRODO...

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (urgent) Where is the Ring? FRODO backs away from ARAGORN ... ARAGORN is shocked by t movement.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Stay away!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Frodo ... I swore to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Can you protect me from yourself? CLOSE ON: FRODO uncurls his fist ... in his palm lies the It glints, gold and beautiful in the afternoon sun ... AR eyes are drawn to it. FRODO (CONT’D) Would you destroy it?

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: Aragorn. Aragorn. Elessar.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (kneeling to Frodo) I would have gone with you to the end . into the very fires of Mordor.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I know. Look after the others, especially Sam ... he will not understand. ARAGORN FREEZES! He draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (urgent) Go, Frodo! FRODO hesitates. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: (yells) Run. Run! FRODO backs away into the trees... ANGLE ON: ...as 200 URUK-HAI SWARM onto AMON HEN behind A ARAGORN attacks the leading URUK-HAI like a madman ... he two down with his sword leaping into the ruins as others in on him. ANGLE ON: FRODO scrambles down the HILLSIDE, away from th fight. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN battles the URUK-HAI, amongst the pilla blocks of AMON HEN. Despite his bravery, he is quickly surrounded. SUDDENLY: ELVEN ARROWS smash into the URUK-HAI. LEGOLAS r out of the woods, firing his bow. GIMLI leaps into the ba wielding his mighty axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO is darting down the steep hillside as heavy feet th down after him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo! ANGLE ON: SAM looks around for FRODO. CLOSE ON: LURTZ ordering his URUKS.

dialogues.speaker: LURTZ
dialogues.text: Find the Halflings ... find the Halflings! ANGLE ON: FRODO stumbles and falls ... quickly he crawls a tree ... above him the sound of URUK-HAI crashing throu forest rings out.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) Frodo! FRODO turns to see MERRY and PIPPIN hiding in a hollow, a feet away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MERRY (CONT’D) Hide here, quick!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Come on! ANGLE ON: FRODO looks at his friends ... slowly shakes hi a great sadness in his eyes. PIPPIN (CONT’D) What's he doing? ANGLE ON: MERRY’S eyes meets FRODO’S. Understanding.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (softly) He's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: No! PIPPIN stands and makes a move toward FRODO .. MERRY grab his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Pippin! ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN look up the slope where a cry rings out. THEY HAVE BEEN SEEN!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: (to Frodo) Run, Frodo. Go on! MERRY waves his arms at the approaching ORCS.

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey you! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Over here!

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: This way! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MERRY and PIPPIN run, leading a pack of ORCS. ANGLE ON: FRODO runs to the lake. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN, still running from the ORCS

dialogues.speaker: PIPPIN
dialogues.text: It's working!

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: I know it's working! Run! MERRY and PIPPIN stop ... more URUK-HAI approach from the direction ... THEY ARE TRAPPED. SUDDENLY! BOROMIR charges up the hillside and blocks the of the leading URUK-HAI. ANGLE ON: THE ECHO OF BOROMIR’S HORN reaches ARAGORN, LEG and GIMLI ... they are battling their way down the SLOPES towards the lake.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: The horn of Gondor!

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Boromir ! ARAGORN desperately slashes his way towards BOROMIR, fell URUK-HAI in his path ... while LEGOLAS and GIMLI fight a GUARD ACTION. ANGLE ON: Many URUK-HAI fall to BOROMIR’S sword as he tri protect MERRY and PIPPIN...

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Run! Run! ANGLE ON: LURTZ takes aim. ANGLE ON: A BLACK ARROW suddenly THUDS into BOROMIR’S che Amazingly, BOROMIR continues fighting, but another arrow another, brings him to his knees. ANGLE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN are scooped off their feet by HAI. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MERRY
dialogues.text: Aaaaagh! Boromir! Boromir! ANGLE ON: LURTZ aims his bow at BOROMIR’S heart ... sudde ARAGORN charges at him, smashing the BOW with his sword. lock into a deadly battle. ANGLE ON: ARAGORN cuts LURTZ down and races towards BOROM lies slumped against a tree ... URUK-HAI arrows sticking his chest. At least 20 dead URUK-HAI lie heaped around BOROMIR. His lies at his feet ... CLOVEN in two.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: (painful gasp) They took the little ones... ARAGORN quickly tries to staunch the flow of BLOOD from BOROMIR’S shoulder. BOROMIR (CONT’D) (panicked) Frodo ... where is Frodo?

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: I let Frodo go. BOROMIR holds Aragorn’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Then you did what I could not. I tried to take the Ring from him.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: The Ring is beyond our reach now.

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Forgive me. I did not see ... I have failed you all.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: No, Boromir. You fought bravely. You have kept your honor. ARAGORN tries to bind BOROMIR’S wound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Leave it! It is over ... the world of Men will fall and all will come to darkness and my city to ruin Aragorn...

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: I do not know what strength is in my blood, but I swear to you ... I will not let the White City fall, nor your people fail...

dialogues.speaker: BOROMIR
dialogues.text: Our people ... our people... ARAGORN places BOROMIR’S sword in his hand. BOROMIR’S fin tighten around the hilt. BOROMIR (CONT’D) I would have followed you, my brother . my captain, my king. ARAGORN lays BOROMIR down. He is dead.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Be at peace, son of Gondor. ARAGORN bends and KISSES BOROMIR’S forehead. LEGOLAS and GIMLI appear behind him ... ARAGORN stands. ARAGORN (CONT’D) They will look for his coming from the White Tower ... but he will not return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the lakeshore, FRODO stands in front of one of the ELV boats, the RING in his palm. ANGLE ON: A distraught SAM ... running as hard as he can the forest...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Frodo! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: FRODO looks to the far side of the river ... th CAMERA moves in on the RING.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I wish the Ring had never come to me. I wish none of this had happened... Tears fall down FRODO’S face...

dialogues.speaker: GANDALF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So do all who live to see such times... but that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us. With renewed determination, FRODO tucks the RING inside h pocket. ANGLE ON: The small figure of FRODO pushing the ELVISH bo the water... ANGLE ON: SAM bursts through the trees and runs toward th FRODO is already paddling away.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (anguished) Not alone, Frodo. Mr. Frodo! ANGLE ON: FRODO, in the boat, paddling steadfastly away f shore ... tears in his eyes ... the voice of SAM carried wind. FRODO whispers to himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: No, Sam. ANGLE ON: SAM looks at the water ... then at the boat. SPLASH! FRODO turns to see SAM launching himself into the

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Go back, Sam! I'm going to Mordor alone. ANGLE ON: SAM splashes hopelessly toward the boat.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Of course you are ... and I'm coming with you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: You can't swim. SAM starts to go under, spluttering and coughing... ANGLE ON: FRODO drops his paddle and scramble backwards i boat... FRODO (CONT’D) (frightened) Sam! ANGLE ON: SAM is underwater ... hands flailing helplessly sinks. CLOSE ON: FRODO’S hand grasping SAM’S... ANGLE ON: FRODO pulls a bedraggled and half-drowned SAM i boat. FRODO and SAM look at each other, out of breath, te water streaming down both their faces.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I made a promise, Mr. Frodo ... a promise. (fierce passion) “Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee.” (sobs) And I don't mean to ... I don't mean to.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh, Sam! FRODO starts to laugh through his tears ... the two frien FRODO (CONT’D) Come on then... The two HOBBITS row through the water...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: Looking down on swiftly flowing water ... BO body slides under CAMERA. He is lying in one of the boats, his arms across his ches his broken horn at his side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY... the boat drops away from CAMERA ... as it plu over the massive FALLS OF RAUROS, disappearing into the v below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS pushes the last boat into the water.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS
dialogues.text: If we are quick, we will catch Frodo and Sam before nightfall. ARAGORN looks toward the far shore: FRODO and SAM’S small can be seen lying on the distant RIVERBANK as FRODO and S off into the forest beyond. He doesn’t react. ANGLE ON: LEGOLAS turns and looks at ARAGORN.

dialogues.speaker: LEGOLAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You mean not to follow them...

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Frodo's fate is no longer in our hands.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Then it has all been in vain ... the Fellowship has failed.

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Not if we hold true to each other. We will not abandon Merry and Pippin to torment and death, not while we have strength left. ARAGORN pulls a HUNTING KNIFE out of his pack and straps

dialogues.speaker: ARAGORN
dialogues.text: Leave all that can be spared behind. CLOSE ON: ARAGORN ... a steely light in his eye. ARAGORN (CONT’D) (grimly) We travel light. Let’s hunt some Orc.

dialogues.speaker: GIMLI
dialogues.text: Yes! Ha! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ARAGORN, LEGOLAS, and GIMLI disappear into the WOODS, fol the URUK-HAI trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRODO and SAM scramble onto a high ridge. WIDE ON: A distant line of SAW TOOTHED mountains below a oppressive sky. Black volcanic smoke rises behind the mou

dialogues.speaker: . MORDOR
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO and SAM look with grim determination.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Mordor! I hope the others find a safer road.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (simply) Strider’11 look after them.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: I don't suppose we'll ever see them again.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We may yet, Mr. Frodo. We may.

dialogues.speaker: FRODO
dialogues.text: Sam? FRODO looks at SAM with great affection ... despite the g outlook, SAM is undeterred... FRODO (CONT’D) I'm glad you're with me. WIDE ON: THE TWO HOBBITS SETTING OFF TOWARD MORDOR. TO BE CONTINUED...
